Reviews.Author: M. Hyman "Artist at large"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this camera from an earlier Rebel XT, and I have to say I love it. I was choosing between this and the more expensive 40D, and for the price difference figured a lighter construction and slower shutter rate was easily worth the $ savings.The camera has a beautiful feel to it, and is significantly enhanced compared to the earlier Rebel line.The LCD back panel is much larger and is very sharp, and there are more dials for rapidly setting options such as ISO, which was harder to access in the Rebel.The shutter has a very firm action to it, the camera is very responsive, and there are a broad range of image control settings; far more than the earlier models. I find the image quality is also much improved from the Rebel, especially with landscapes.I also like having the broader ISO range it supplies. I still havent' figured out how to access the extended ISO settings to get to 12800, but have shot at 3200.The lens kit comes with an image stabilizer; it sounds cool but i haven't experimented with it.It is very easy to view the settings on the back panel and the view finder, and there are lovely details such as the back display shutting off when you near the view finder so as to prevent light overload on the eye.The camera features a video recorder as well, which is beautiful. I shot some video of my daughter ice skating. The video quality was excellent, with no skipping issues, and with a 16G memory card there is room for 40 minutes of video (in theory). It is fantastic to be able to leave my dv camera behind and just use this one, along with the SLR lenses.Like the earlier Rebels, it is a light body, with convenient button placement, diopter adjustments, etc. I find the button placement and menu layout much improved.All together, I'm thrilled with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: Jason Jones
Reviews.Content: I was holding out to get the new Canon Rebel T1i with the HD video and it was worth it. The old point and shoot just wasn't cutting it and it was always breaking and just didn't take the quality pictures we wanted. The Rebel performs so well and I'm sure I haven't even utilized all the incredible features. I basically opened up the box, took out the camera, and started shooting. With just a little bit of photography experience, I have been able to get some amazing photos.The HD video is a nice added feature. You can get a great picture and focus in and out to add some interest. I wouldn't say it would cut it if you are a video camera buff, but it does the trick for videoing family events etc.I LOVE THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: this canon 500d is awesome
Reviews.Author: Gil Tenefrancia Jr.
Reviews.Content: this is an entry level dslr but the features are comparable to a professional dslr and i'm only using an 18-200 canon lens. how much more if i am using the more expensive ones. I'm a point and shoot camera guy and i never had any problem with the shift to dslr because of the ease in operation of he camera. I did not regret buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome pictures, good movies
Reviews.Author: Kendall Miler
Reviews.Content: Well built, not too heavy camera takes simply amazing pictures.  This is our first SLR and we realy enjoy the simple automatic mode selection for quick use and the ability to revert to full manual for more challenging shots.  The rapid fire mode has been great for catching in action moments (taking several pictures in rapid succession) and made for some fun web animations.I highly recommend ignoring the kit lens and buying a good dedicated lens for the best pictures (it really makes a difference) even though a good lens is nearly the cost of the camera.  We got the Canon EF 24-70MM as our primary and the pair can't be beat.Canon EF 24-70mm f/2.8L USM Standard Zoom Lens for Canon SLR Cameras

Reviews.Title: What a bargain!
Reviews.Author: Lzo. Tomas
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the Rebel T1i as a backup camera for my EOS 40D, and I find I am using it more and more as my main camera.  It's smaller, lighter, has more megapixels, and shoots movies, too.  It's really closer to the 50D in performance than the 40D, but for a lot less money than either one. Unless you need 6.5 fps shooting of the 50D and a few features that the T1i lacks, this camera is the better bet.

Reviews.Title: Made in Taiwan vs. Made in Japan
Reviews.Author: NK
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and I agree with all of the positive points that everyone else mentioned in all of the reviews.My only problem is that I bought this camera from Amazon and I noticed that it is made in Taiwan but when I checked the one in Costco, it was made in Japan!I think Amazon should have mentioned this in the product description, this might not be an issue for a lot of people but it is certainly a big deal for me.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: T. Lior
Reviews.Content: Before buying this camera I looked into the Nikon D5000 as well. Evetually, my best friend got the Nikon and I got the Canon.  Picture quality is about the same, also their ability to shoot in low light conditions. The Canon is Lighter than the Nikon (about 100g) and smaller in dimensions. Additionally, the Canon has more function buttons which allow to change many settings without having to go through the Menu.I would most definately recommend others to buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Solid body and decent photo Quality
Reviews.Author: suresh
Reviews.Content: I Purchased this Camera from Amazon on November 14, 2011. I have already entered into 3rd year and counting.. I must admit this is the great camera, takes good quality photos. I used this camera with the lens it came with and I bought few Macro lenses and 75-300mm lens. Works perfectly with all lenses I bought so far and gives a decent quality photos. As beginner photographer I enjoyed taking shots in all aspects of photography Starting from Macro to HDR photos.Solid Body and solid lens:(Long lasting)In three years I dropped this camera at-least 4 times on carpet and I still remember It fell with tripod on the wooden floor. Guess what, not even one time I had trouble after dropping it. No technical issues so far.I would highly recommend for the beginners!

Reviews.Title: EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS
Reviews.Author: Roger Michels
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the features needed to produce professional results. I upgraded from an inexpensive point and shoot camera to the T1i, and the manual and software that came with the camera made the transition easy. Canon's website is loaded with helpful information to make taking photos FUN.

Reviews.Title: This camera is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Joshua N. Hinds
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 5 years, and have taken it everywhere from fishing trips (where it often gets a little wet) to sporting events and summer camp.  I am not one to be terribly  careful with may camera, and it isn't uncommon to see me chest deep in a lake or swimming pool at summer camps getting awesome pictures of campers having fun from angles not usually seen from the waters edge. I have dropped it more than I'd like to admit, the worst drop was on a drizzly day taking pictures of my dog when I slipped on some mud and pretty much broke my fall with the camera on concrete... I thought for sure it was toast, but that was three years ago, and now the only thing that doesn't work on the camera is the built in flash, which i never use anyway. This camera has been through every temperature range Michigan has to offer, from long 100+ degree days in in constant sun out on Lake Huron, to the negative temps at Snow Fest in Frankenmuth, and it has never had single hiccup. There really is nothing I don't like about the camera, and if I ever have to travel back in time to 2009 I would buy another one in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Used it for a few years, like the compact size with decent features
Reviews.Author: Roberto F
Reviews.Content: Camera body has to be compact, light, and with adequate features. You should spend $$ on decent lens. Ok, this camera doesn't have an LCD setting display, you'll have to use the screen, it doesn't have image review big zoom-in to check if the photo is sharp (you'll have to press + several times), no customizeable quick function button (like bracketting), but everything else is good enough for my needs. At the end, I like the customizeable contrast setting, AP and P modes, good lasting battery and compact size. When I need to upgrade camera, will probably do something similar: not the high end camera body. Skip the kit lens, they are terrible.

Reviews.Title: Canon T1i
Reviews.Author: Rachel Grande
Reviews.Content: The absolute best camera and a wonderful pricepoint. Perfect for a novice and a professional. Buying a camera can be so confusing and hectic. This camera was a nobrainer and ease of use is fantastic. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Very Good camera when I use it.
Reviews.Author: gregbgh
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning the neat stuff I can do with this camera even after 4 years of owning it. My Photos are coming out very well, and it takes the photos very quickly. It has a quick turn on time for an old digital camera, and the battery life  or power consumption is great. It just keeps taking photos in the dark and light.

Reviews.Title: beginner level SLR
Reviews.Author: Ulas Ergin "ulasergin"
Reviews.Content: I bought this one from amazon. After 15 or so shots using flash it says 'flash busy' and rejects to shoot for some small period.Closing the flash helps, it pops automatically immediately with no problem so after 15+ shots with flash i have to close the flash manually before shooting again..Other than his small annoyance, photo quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Kate Houk
Reviews.Content: Great camera body for hobbyist! It's not so big that I feel like I'm lugging around at Tank, but its substantial enough to feel good in the hand. I know I'll have to upgrade a some point, but this camera has plenty of features and benefits tat I can learn on now.

Reviews.Title: buy it..
Reviews.Author: cristian
Reviews.Content: bought this as a present for my girlfriend..shipping was great. the camera was well sealed no scratches or dings. works like new..still own it and works like new..highly recommend it to anyone looking for great quality pictures and HD movie

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: AmazonBuyer
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It does what it supposed to for a prosumer model. I've taken high speed snaps as well as video.  You have to have a memory card that is fast enough.  I've tried several different one until I landed on the SanDisk Extreme 32 GB SDHC Class 10 UHS-1

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Mauro serrano
Reviews.Content: Conclusion - Pros  Good resolution and detailed output (but only very marginally better than 450D)  Decent (but not 'best in class') high ISO JPEG performance  Extended ISO speed up to 12800 (not great quality but it's there for emergencies)  Good quality HD video (but sound output does not match the image quality)  Currently the cheapest 1080P video capable DSLR (albeit only at 20fps)  Overall snappy and responsive performance  Very clear, high resolution 3.0 inch screen with anti-reflection coating (but still hardly usable in sunny conditions)  Brightest and largest viewfinder in class  Good number of external controls provide quick access to all important shooting parameters and the interactive quick control panel is a good alternative for those who prefer the compact camera style of controls  Intuitive menu system and customizable 'My Menu'  Good control over High ISO NR  Fairly efficient Highlight Tone Priority features preserves some additional highlight detail  Reliable flash exposure  Peripheral illumination correction  Optional battery grip  HDMI output  Comprehensive software package included  Good battery lifeConclusion - Cons  Visibly more noise in RAW files than some of the competition  Slightly less highlight range in JPGs than the competition  Relatively limited RAW headroom, channel clipping means color accuracy can often not be maintained when recovering clipped areas in RAW conversion  Metering has occasional tendencies to overexpose in very bright, contrasty conditions  Unreliable auto white balance and presets under artificial light  Still slightly plasticy appearance and surfaces  Grip is a little small for larger hands  Flash has to be raised for AF assist (although AF is good even in low light)  Limited exposure compensation range (+/- 2.0 EV)  Contrast detect AF so slow it's useless for most types of photography (it's the same for most of the competition though)  Slightly more expensive than the competitionOverall conclusionThe EOS 500D is the latest incarnation of a highly successful line of cameras and although the 'entry level' market segment is these days much more crowded than it used to be, we would be very surprised if the new model would not sell like hotcakes.All the major manufacturers cram more and more new features into their 'budget' offerings but the EOS 500D is arguably the currently best specced camera in the segment, which lifts it some distance above pure 'entry level' territory. It comes with the highest resolution sensor (15.1 effective megapixels) in its class, an excellent 3.0 inch high resolution screen, extended sensitivity up to ISO 12800 and the arguably for many users most attractive new feature, a movie mode that records 1080P/20fps or 720P/30fps High Definition video footage.It combines all this with decent image quality and while its appearance might be a little plasticy and the handling can be difficult with larger hands the 500D's main problem could be that it's a little pricier than most of its direct competitors which, in these times of economic turmoil, might render it less attractive to some potential buyers.Image QualityAt base ISO the 500D produces clean and detailed output with natural colors but to make the most of the camera's 15 megapixels for big enlargements or cropping you should invest in good lenses. At least towards the edges of the frame the kit-lenses struggle to resolve all the detail in a scene.The Canon does a decent job at higher sensitivities and up to ISO 1600 produces perfectly usable output that shows good detail but also visibly more chroma noise than the Nikon D5000 (if you're willing to sacrifice some image detail you get rid of it almost entirely by setting noise reduction to 'Strong' though). ISO 3200 gets visibly softer and the two highest settings produce a very intrusive type of color noise. They should therefore be firmly reserved for emergency situations.When shooting in RAW the picture changes slightly to the negative. The 'extra quality' you can usually get out of RAW files compared to shooting in JPEG is relatively limited on the 500D. One reason for that is the quality of the camera's JPEG engine. It is doing a pretty good job at 'optimizing' the JPEG output when converting the RAW data. However, the 500D's RAW images are also slightly lagging behind some of the competition and surprisingly even the 450D in terms of high ISO noise and to a smaller degree in terms of pixel level detail. It's not going to be an issue when checking images at screen size but it's certainly visible up-close.Metering is generally reliable but, like the 450D, in bright conditions the EOS 500D has a tendency to overexpose resulting in clipping of highlights. And although the JPEG dynamic range in the highlights is slightly smaller than on the predecessor there's enough headroom in raw files to pull back highlight detail in most of those shots. It's therefore recommendable, especially in bright and contrasty conditions, to always shoot JPEG + RAW. Otherwise you'd better check your exposures carefully and apply some negative exposure compensation where necessary.HandlingWe have in the past been slightly critical about the handling of the 500D's predecessors and we're still not too keen on the camera's ergonomics. The grip is comparatively small and, especially for photographers with larger hands, the camera doesn't sit as comfortably in the hand as, for example, the Nikon D5000 or Olympus E-620. The external controls give you good access to the most frequently changed shooting parameters but we'd love to see a 50D style second control wheel. Having said that we are looking at a budget camera here and the manufacturers have to draw the line somewhere.The menu design is very intuitive and for everybody stepping up from a digital compact camera the Quick Control Screen will be a welcome alternative to changing settings via the hard buttons. All in all the EOS 500D is a camera that, after some initial adaption time, you will find easy to use. Just make sure you hold one before you buy and check if its smallish grip is suitable for you.Like most current SLRs the live view feature is, mainly due to the very slow AF, of limited use outside the studio and while the video mode delivers excellent quality footage it offers very little manual control. None of these points are deal breakers though and Canon might even, like it did in the case of the 5D Mark II, at some point offer a new firmware to allow for more manual interference.The final wordIf you currently own an EOS 450D or another fairly recent entry-level DSLR from an image quality point of view there is not necessarily a need to upgrade to the EOS 500D. However, the HD video mode, new high-resolution screen or extended ISO range make it easier to justify the expense if you're likely to use these features. For anybody buying their first DSLR the 500D is an easy recommendation but you might want to have a look at the Nikon D5000 as well. It comes with a similar feature set to the 500D ('only' 720P video though) and performs slightly better in low light.Please Visit [...]

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal Camera
Reviews.Author: JasonB
Reviews.Content: When buying this camera, this was the best camera for it's price, as compared to the newer Canon Rebel series. Compared to the T2, T3, and T4i series cameras, this is a bare-minimum SLR that doesn't feature all the other features that those did. It offers a great 15.1 MP picture. I have had no problems with this for the year that I have had it. A great beginners camera when stepping up from a point-and-shoot to a DLSR.

Reviews.Title: If you're going pro, skip this camera
Reviews.Author: E
Reviews.Content: Well, I got this camera as my very first DSLR and I've had it for about three years now. It was a great starter DSLR, but I've already outgrown it and am looking for something with much better image quality. Not to say that it's terrible, but as you become a professional, image quality is a MUST. It's hard to get those super sharp images on this camera, even with the auto focus, a tiny aperture, and low a low iso. I've also noticed that there are a TON of dead pixels which become really apparent on long shutter images. I have used the sensor cleaning option and it didn't make much of a difference. Not that it's a big deal for most people, but the bulb setting sucks as you have to literally hold down the shutter button the whole time. The lens that comes with this camera is pretty lame. The AF on it is super loud and you can definitely see some minor distortion along the edges. I guess, when it comes down to it, if you are looking to start a business and sell your photography, skip this camera and go straight to a better one. If you just want a camera to take pictures better than your average point and shoot cam, this is perfect for you. I do love the settings menu on canon cameras as they are super easy to navigate and figure out which is great when you need to switch your settings in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: Love this for the obvious reasons. Upgraded from a Canon XS (1000D).
Reviews.Author: Adrian Waller
Reviews.Content: High quality camera. I can't quite afford a full-frame or a nicer DSLR that takes video, so this camera is my entry into cameras with video.The video capability does what it needs to do, though I need to buy a bigger SDHC card to be able to take videos of decent length.I upgraded from a Canon XS (1000D), so the specs of the T1i are amazing. I love the FPS, the higher ISO (1600 vs 800 on the XS, not to mention the expanded ISO!), and the HUGE LCD screen. I sold my XS to my sister-in-law, and when I looked at her screen, it felt like a toy comparatively.The slight re-design of the buttons from the XS proves to be useful and intuitive.The Live View shooting is leaps and bounds better than on the XS - this one actually has auto-focus (though very, very slow) while using Live View.And of course, there's all the other standard features you'd expect from a Canon DSLR - many others have mentioned these points.All in all, I'd make the purchase again and recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: First DSLR Expirience
Reviews.Author: Fritosgirl
Reviews.Content: The Canon EOS Rebel T1i was my first DSLR experience. Up until then, I had used traditional point and shoot camera's with all automatic settings and no len switching technology.  There are a ton of reviews with specs and things of that nature, so I am not going over those.  Here are a few thoughts regarding the T1i.The Look: I love the size of this.  My biggest problem with camera's today is that they seem to be shrinking.  I hold the camera more study when it is larger, has some weight, and doesn't fit in a cell phone case.  The T1i is great for me and I've found that it's design helps keep the camera stable.  The functions on the back and top are (for the most part) well placed.Picture Quality: While I have little to judge it against, I must say I love the picture quality I've received from this camera!Video Quality:  I don't find the video elements built into the T1i to be as user friendly as taking stills.  The record button isn't in a very 'intuitive' spot, if you ask me!  It would be better placed elsewhere.  Also (and I may just still be new to this) shooting in low light area's never seems to work very well in terms of getting the proper focus.  Even in 'regular' lighting, the focus hops back and forth sometimes, which is a little irritating.Overall:  This camera takes great pictures.  I love the quality for what is a pretty good price.  Wish the video was better, but since this seems to have been the first attempt at putting video in a DSLR from Canon, I'll give it a pass for now.  All in all, I do love this camera!

Reviews.Author: Roma
Reviews.Content: Hi I am very pleased with the unit everything is in place and in excellent condition, My score is 5 +

Reviews.Title: camera canon EOS REbel t1 15.1
Reviews.Author: patk
Reviews.Content: Its takes wonderful pictures and is easy to use for a novice photographer.  I am happy I bought it from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Happy Novice
Reviews.Author: M. Rohlfing
Reviews.Content: As a guy who knows extremely little about photography, Im really happy with my purchase. Set to fully automatic, this thing is taking pro like photos right out of the box. I purchased the "T1i for Dummies" book and after three days feel super confident surfing through most of the features this camera has. If you are a novice like me and want to take professional quality photos, this camera is a great choice even if you dont venture away from full auto. I would suggest the "For Dummies" series if you want to get a step by step tour through all of the cameras features and capabilities. Taking more creative shots is made easy with the camera/ book combo.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: carlos
Reviews.Content: Is a veryyy good camera..canon is the best absolutly..I recomend it for the quality and price..great camera, I love it..!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Entry Level DSLR
Reviews.Author: David Chen
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera kit to learn DSLR and for that this is perfect camera for me.  I have used the camera under different conditions and it always surprised me on the positive side.

Reviews.Title: I love my camera!
Reviews.Author: Aubs
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for over a year now and it has never failed me! I am an amateur though. Just a teenage girl being creative. It takes amazing photos. I have the 18-55mm lens and the 55-250mm lens. They both work wonderful for me although I just broke my 18-55mm one. :[ I've actually been having withdrawals. I would really recommend this for beginner photographers and people who are just looking for a nice camera for not too much money.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased!
Reviews.Author: JC82
Reviews.Content: Love my camera! It's exactly what I was looking for. I really enjoy using it. I wanted to invest in something that would help me to capture my kids growing up and this suits me perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Sweet camera for shooting RAW photos
Reviews.Author: OregonBay "© OregonBay - 1999 to 2014"
Reviews.Content: Ok, I've been using this for about a year, mostly for outdoor photography.  I also bought the Canon EF-S 55-250mm f/4.0-5.6 IS Telephoto Zoom Lens for Canon Digital SLR Cameras for closeups.  You can get these together in a kit now for less than what I paid, so shop around!This is actually my third SLR, but my first DSLR.  My other cameras were pretty basic, the old Pentax K-1000, and a Minolta Maxxum 300si, so this Canon is quite an upgrade for me.Pros:Autofocus is pretty fast and accurate.RAW + JpegRecharging batteryImage stabilizationMenu is fairly simpleAbility to setup custom settings for easy accessLots of settings, from basic "point and shoot" to more complex creative featuresGood compatibility with Mac'sCons:Like most SLR's, it's big and somewhat heavyShooting in low light is not always easy, if the meter cannot assess the low light situation the shutter will not activateSoftware it comes with is not very good.  I bought Aperture to edit my RAW photos and removed the software this came with.Video is choppy at 1080pOverall this is a wonderful camera, and a huge upgrade over point and shoot or film based SLR's.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS!
Reviews.Author: li58072
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a month ago and hadn't really gotten to use it, until last weekend when I shot my friend, her husband, and daughter. Now, I love it even more. All i need to do now, is purchase a larger card so I don't have stop and switch cards 3 quarters of the way through the shoot :) LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent option for amature photographers!!!
Reviews.Author: Linwood Powell Jr. "Invincible Brotha"
Reviews.Content: I bought this DSLR because I wanted to phase-up from my 5 yr old olympus P&S; camera and I finally had the money to buy one without making a sacrifice. Right out of the box, this camera was ready to go. With the kit lens I was able to take very crisp and clear pictures with the kit lens set to f/8.0, 1/60 shutter speed. The buttons and menus are very easy to understand and large enough to be readable. Though primarily made of plastic material, the camera feels sturdy and lightweighted. The kit lens provided will take decent photos depending on the situation, but it is ultimately a very cheap lens and you will not get the most out of your investment with just the kit lens, so it is my personal recommendation that you purchase a more advance and pricier lens (Sigma or Tamron for example) that will really help you take your photography to a professional-looking level. Nevertheless, for 650 bucks you get a great amateur DSLR kit. I will be posting pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: I've had it for several months now and absolutely love it. The battery stays charged for a very long time, even in cold weather. The pictures are crisp, and if you are learning how to use a DSLR it is a great starter camera. The lens that comes with it isn't the best by any means, but it was great for starting out and I haven't had a problem out of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For Beginner
Reviews.Author: Jessica M. Brant
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this camera shortly after moving to Europe so that we could better capture our adventures here. Neither of us had any experience with SLR cameras, but we were both able to operate this camera immediately in all of its basic modes. We are still learning the manual settings, which are really fun to experiment with. We've already learned a lot from this camera and the pictures we've been able to take with it are clear and crisp. The HD video quality is really great, but it's hard to edit it on your computer unless you have some decent video editing software. Windows movie maker just doesn't cut it. We've had this camera for over 6 months now and we couldn't be happier with it!

Reviews.Title: very comprhensive camera
Reviews.Author: Gloria M. Bain ""morningglory""
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed using my Canon Rebel T1i.  I was able to get it through Amazon at what I thought was a really good price, with lens attached! The quality is great and so are the photos. The only thing I don't like is that with most the settings I have to look through the view finder instead of the window. Or maybe I just don't have it all figured out yet.  But my son says my photos are two to three hundred times better, so that counts for something!

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal..
Reviews.Author: Justin A. Pierce
Reviews.Content: I'm sure there are plenty of other in-depth reviews to look through so I'll keep this simple. This camera is amazing. It is my first DSLR but comparing it to my best friends D3100 it is much better in quite a few ways. If you are just getting started I would recommend this camera to you. The only thing that is lacking in my opinion is the video. Its a pain in the arse to focus it at first but you get used to it. Also It only shoots 20fps in full HD so you will notice a lackluster video. Otherwise, go for it. Get this camera. (its easy on the wallet too!)

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: My two cents
Reviews.Content: The Canon Rebel T1i was my first foray into the world of DSLRs. I took it on several hikes and the picture quality is amazing. I'm still learning all the different features instead of just using the basic point and shoot feature, so if the pictures don't look that good, I doubt it's because of the camera!My camera is made in Taiwan - I remember reading that others' were made in Japan. Anyway, Taiwan is known for making top quality cameras and I haven't had any problems with it.  Great compact camera that is easy enough for a newbie to use, and yet packed with enough features to even keep my more-experienced photographer friends pleased.

Reviews.Title: Love it so much, I'm buying a second one.
Reviews.Author: Diane Jolliffe
Reviews.Content: I upgraded last year from a Rebel XT to the T1i. I've been so completely happy over the past year with my T1i. It has great image quality, shoots really high quality HD video, is light weight and very customizable. I love it so much in fact, I'm buying a second one - this way I can keep my 500mm lens on one and use the second one for quick swap out with my other lenses.I highly recommend buying one now since Canon just put out the T3i - you can get the T1i at a great price. Unless your selling your photos there's no need for anything more than the T1i.

Reviews.Title: Great Starter Kit
Reviews.Author: Sterling Howells
Reviews.Content: I have just recently become really interested in photography and needed a camera. I asked around for people's thoughts on different cameras and all of them said, "Canon." And they were right. This camera has the basic automatic settings like any point and shoot camera, but also gives you control over a range of settings. The manual settings allow you to change the outcome of a picture and really take control of what you're shooting. The user manual gives you a lot of different setting adjustments to begin with, but allows you to build upon those settings. I bought the T1i because it was one of the many different SLRs I was familiar with. I highly recommend this camera to anyone who is starting out in photography and wants an easy to use SLR.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: DeeDee Metcalf
Reviews.Content: Crystal clear pictures! Much cheaper on Amazon then ANYWHERE else for exactly the same product. Very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: A godsend!!!!
Reviews.Author: pmtneal
Reviews.Content: First of all this camera is amazing and perfect for anyone starting out in photography and an indie filmmaker which is what I am.  I have shot a few shorts with this camera and it has beautiful results on it.  I grew tired of having to buy 35mm adapters for my camcorder just to give it a pro look and this answered my prayers with the ability to do depth of field without having to flip the damn screen to view what you filming and if you've ever played around with a 35mm adapter you know what I'm talking about.  The one accessory you may want to by with this camera is timer for shooting time lapse which is what I love to do on down time.  The kit comes with software to do time lapse, but you have to drag your computer around with you everywhere you go so I bought the Shoot MC-36d and for about 20.00 and it does the job well.  I've only had the camera for a short time and I love it so if you get a chance click the buy button now!!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T1i Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel A. Goodwin "regards"
Reviews.Content: Good starter camera. This camera takes quality pictures and does not cost a whole lot. You can purchase additional lenses which is a plus. The settings are easy to figure out and use for those who are not fimiliar with photography. Very user friendly. The battery life is good as well.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Hayashi
Reviews.Content: I am a novice SLR user and I've been able to take great pictures with my limited knowledge and the stock lense.  Just by reading the manual (a little bit), I have been learning its basic features.  I hope to take a class to learn about its full capacities though.I would highly recommend this camera for any newbies out there too.  I did quite a bit of price shopping and no one could be Amazon's price.

Reviews.Title: excelente DCLR camera!
Reviews.Author: wonka
Reviews.Content: if you don't wanna spent too much in this type of camera, but wants great pictures... thats the camer for you!!!!!hands down the best choice for entry level amateur photografers!could have come with a better lens...

Reviews.Title: A Rock-Solid DSLR for People Who Want to Compose Great Pix
Reviews.Author: J. Olin "Joe On the Go"
Reviews.Content: The Canon EOS Rebel T1i demonstrates why Canon has the reputation as one of the world's great imaging companies. The reviews found at [...] do a much better job than I in describing the multiple features and benefits found in this camera. It is a great alternative - and better value - than the Rebel T2i for those users who don't need the 1080p movie feature and larger LCD display. Unless you are a serious image pro - the difference between this and the T2i will probably seem insignificant - at least they were to my eyes and way of thinking. For those users who have other Canon 35MM or DSLR lenses at home, the ability to use most with the T1i is a great thing.In the field, the T1i is fast, comfortable in most hands and very easy to configure on the fly. I can't imagine going out without it.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use right out of the box
Reviews.Author: JENNIFERMK1
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for two days and I'm already taking great pictures. Its easy to use right out of the box. I did lots of research and this was definitely the camera for me. I'm in love. It did not disappoint! Its my first SLR after owning two point and shoots and I'm so glad I upgraded. I love that I can take pictures inside without the flash. I hate using the flash!

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!
Reviews.Author: FirstTimeMama
Reviews.Content: This camera is incredible! I'm an amateur photographer and this is a perfect fit for my needs. 18-55mm is a great lens but i think soon I will need a better lens since my daughter will be walking/running within the next year. My hands are a little on the shaky side and needed the stabilizer function. I have so much to learn still but if you are an amateur photographer looking to upgrade from a regular ol' digital camera I recommend investing your money in this camera!

Reviews.Title: amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Chintan
Reviews.Content: i recently bought this camera.. and i just love it... it takes amazing pictures and the kit lens is very good... i would highly recommend this camera..... at this price.. its a steal!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for Photos & recording as well
Reviews.Author: Rockwellrunner
Reviews.Content: I recieved this camera for Christmas, and love it. The quality of the photographs are amazing, along with the quality of the recording. As far as the videos go dO realize it's semi hard because your manually zooming in and out with the lens. Along with that don't expect Hugh quality audio recording. How ever this camera still picks up audio very well and is the best cross over camera around.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera.
Reviews.Author: MAT
Reviews.Content: Really like the camera and speed of shutter.  Takes awesome pictures.  We ended up buying 2:  one for us and one for a family member.

Reviews.Title: My DSLR cherry was popped
Reviews.Author: Glock Shooter
Reviews.Content: I got tired of the point and shoot cameras. The main thing about them was the poor picture quality that you would get from them. So I decided on a dslr and i can say, i am impressed with it. i am new to the dslr world so this camera was very intimidating when i pulled it out of the box, but once i read the manual and the books that came with i got more comfortable with it and slowly began to take better pictures. I would have to say that this camera is awesome.Update: 2-11-2011I have a had plenty of time to mess around with this camera since i bought and i get more and more impressed with it. I am a novice when it comes to photography, but my pictures have improved drastically. It is nice to take a picture of my daughter playing outside and it not being blurry, compared to the point and shoot cameras. I did however make the mistake of leaving the battery in when i wasn't using it and it drained the battery and now it doesn't last as long on a charge. That is completely my fault. I will never buy a point and shoot camera ever again.

Reviews.Title: In love with my first DSLR
Reviews.Author: F Cantrell
Reviews.Content: I am sooo in love with this camera!! This is my first DSLR camera & also my first Canon camera purchase. I was terrified at the thought of upgrading from my Kodak Easyshare to the Canon Rebel T1i. I was afraid I wouldn't be able to operate the camera & that I would lose many shots. I was very shocked at how easy this camera is to use! As long as you understand that you need to first push the shutter half way down to auto focus, then all the way down to shoot, then you should have NO PROBLEMS using this camera. I have owned this camera now for 1 month. I have taken thousands, yes, thousands of pictures with it already. I took 435 yesterday in 4 hours of some friends & families children riding snow tubes. They turned out perfect!! There were a few(maybe 10-12) that were blurry, but I am certain that it was due to something I did wrong. I have taken several portraits of my own children that people have asked where I had them taken at because they looked professional. I purchased the camera with kit lens & also purchased the Canon EF-S 55-250mm f/4.0-5.6 IS Telephoto Zoom Lens. The lens that came in the kit does very well, just doesn't zoom as far as I was used to with my point & shoot 12X zoom. I knew this would be an issue for me which is why I went on & purchased the additional zoom lens. The Canon EF-S 55-250mm f/4.0-5.6 IS Telephoto Zoom Lens I purchased is awesome!! The only problem(for my wallet)is that I would like to find one lens that covers the whole zoom area of the two lenses combined :) I'm certain that I have purchased one of the most AMAZING cameras on the market & I can't wait to learn more about how to use it to its fullest abilities!! I would, and DO, recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T1i 15.1 MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera with 3-Inch LCD and EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS Lens
Reviews.Author: ElsaArtGlass
Reviews.Content: After having a chance to use this camera for awhile I am very satisfied with it.  Easy to use, no problems to report.  Controls are within easy reach, photo quality excellent, battery life is great.

Reviews.Title: a fine camera
Reviews.Author: manleonardo
Reviews.Content: is a good camera for the price. is deficient in customizations and video management, but let it work well. (Greetings from Colombia)

Reviews.Title: Great entry-level camera for beginners
Reviews.Author: Niel
Reviews.Content: Canon made a good move with the T1i, which brings photography enthusiasts closer into the realm of quality cameras by mixing features that are both novice-friendly and highly powerful.

Reviews.Title: canon t1i rebel
Reviews.Author: spiggly
Reviews.Content: this camera is amazing, I purchased this last march and have absolutely no regrets, i have taking 50,000 + pictures on it and many videos and it still works flawlessly. it has a great price for the value, The images are extremely sharp with the 18-55mm kit lenses but i would recommend looking into upgrading to a longer range zoom eventually. every function an button is placed for maximum convenience and it is easy to constantly change the functions in the manual modes. I have took this camera everywhere with me on all my trips from rafting the Colorado river in the grand canyon to skiing the peaks, and biking the hills and my adventures with this camera have left me with precious memories and works of art.

Reviews.Title: "Greatness" is only a click away.
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so I could take my own pictures and use them for my graphic art projects. This camera is awesome all the way around. It is pricy, but it is worth every penny. I asked my friend who is a semi-pro photographer what he recommended for a "starter camera" and this is that, and THEN some. The quality of pictures is absolutely stunning. I do recommend reading the manual before using it though because it has so many buttons and numbers that are not on your everyday camera. Once you get past those things, you're golden.

Reviews.Title: Finally, I can use my Canon lenses to shoot video!
Reviews.Author: Hoyt
Reviews.Content: Having spent the last four years shooting still frames with my wife's Canon digital Rebel XT (which I gave her for Christmas), she bought me this model for its ability to shoot high definition video through the same great lenses we bought for our photography hobby.  Knowing the limitations ahead of time is important though, and I knew what I was getting.  The viewfinder is blocked when shooting video, so you must use the [large] screen on the back.  Also the autofocus doesn't work in video mode.  You can autofocus before you start shooting, but if you have an object moving beyond the depth of field, you have to focus manually on the fly.  Also, audio is in Mono.  This is no problem for me because I'll be mixing the audio signal in Pro Tools and putting it in a stereophonic field if necessary.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - worth the $
Reviews.Author: J. Medina
Reviews.Content: Great Camera! Canon has really packed a lot of capability in a small package. Picture quality is great, easy to use, great 3.0" LCD display and fits great in your hands. Video is Good but NOT a primary video camera. The focus/zoom feature is very weak, the T2i would be much better. For the price, totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: RLJordanIII
Reviews.Content: I'm a beginner with this camera and I can say that it is perfect for me. I love that I can easily take a picture or record a video then transfer it to my computer within seconds. I do refer this camera to anyone who is looking for a entry level Camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Quality For The Price
Reviews.Author: Richard H. Sweet
Reviews.Content: I have owned a EOS Rebel for six years and was pleased with it except when using with the Canon flash. This camera is a big step above the old one. It has greater low light capabilities and works well with the Canon flash. I haven't had occasion to use the video capabilities of it yet. The PC/Camera interface works very well. Overall, I am very pleased with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Wow!  What an improvement.
Reviews.Author: texastiny
Reviews.Content: I got the original Digital Rebel years ago.  Finally gave out on me.  Thought I was just shelling out $500 for replacement, but this new model is fantastic.  Incredible flexibility.  Great speed.  And, of course, it uses all but one of my EOS lenses.

Reviews.Title: canon eos rebel t1i is overall AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: J. Castro "chicago schmicago"
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera about a month ago and have been experimenting with it ever since. i bought it after reading several rave reviews (was rated #1 customer-purchase last year in some worldwide research). i bought the lens kit and i would have to say that if you are SLR savvy then skip the lens kit because to me the quality and output of this lens is just "average" nothing special / you can buy or acquire a much nicer lenses (i.e. I bought some inexpensive canon FD and pentax super takumar lenses from ebay and works perfect with an adapter also available on ebay). just this weekend, i was at a family event, took pics using the T1i plus super-takumar 50mm f1.4 lens -  results were real nice; crisp quality in image and in color!  i did black/white video (same lens) and it looks real sharp / like proffessional grade!  i would recommend the canon eos rebel T1i with a caveat to use other lenses / not the kit lens / just my opinion;  canon makes real good products and someone told me that they even use canon lenses these days to film tv productions. last note from me, if you buy from amazon, be prepared to see the price fluctuate (most likely you will pay more for it today than next week / that happened to me / price was $20 cheaper the following week / and amazon will not give you a refund to guarantee lowest price.

Reviews.Title: 16 Month Review
Reviews.Author: Conflicted Consumer
Reviews.Content: Have been using this camera for 16 months, including under extreme conditions, and still loving it.  Have it permanently to a Tamron 18-270 zoom so I never have expose the sensor to dust. The combo fits very well into the Zoom Pack 1000, and the case has been holding up fine and protecting the camera. Invest in a good fast memory card if you want to shoot RAW bursts, otherwise it takes a few seconds after a burst for your card to absorb the images.

Reviews.Title: Perfect upgrade from the XTi.
Reviews.Author: C. Stone
Reviews.Content: I have only had the T1i for one day, so I can't give you all the ins and outs, ups and downs of this product. But so far, I am in love. The first thing I noticed was that overall, the T1i body is VERY similar to the XTi body. With the exceptions of a larger screen (and the button placement changes because of that) and a repositioned ISO button, everything is very similar.The battery charges very quickly, and if it is anything like my other canon batteries, it will hold a charge for a very long time.The screen is large and displays everything, including the menu, gorgeously. The menus themselves are easy to navigate.The video feature would be great for interview or vlog style videos. Focusing while recording can be very loud (even with USM lenses) so as long as you're focused on one fixed point and you stay there, you should be fine. (Not to mention that trying to record any heavy action at 30fps isn't going to produce the greatest quality.) This SHOULD NOT be your main video setup. It's not equipped for that, and if that's why you're purchasing this camera, you're better off with a different model.I will most likely update this later with a more extensive review, but for 1 day out of the box, I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Rebel it is
Reviews.Author: Sanket
Reviews.Content: Rebel it is .... It is perfect DSLR body to have ... not very expensive ... has got the advanced features like the Video an live view ... So save some money in the body as compared to buying a T2i and buy better lenses .. my2cents - Sanket

Reviews.Title: Great Value for a Newbie
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: For my birthday I received the T1i with 18-55 & 55-250 on this site at an amazing price.  I admit have always been a point and shoot gal but to get a good picture with two little ones I needed something faster.  Love the HD video (I have no room for extra gadgets) and fast shutter speed!  Recently I purchased the T1i guide by Jeff Revell (a must have for a newbie like me) and I am getting some fantastic shots!  I can't wait to pull out the camera each day and learn something new!!!  The photo quality seems fantastic but I admit have no history with DSLRs.  It was tough to beat the value in this price range!Canon Rebel T1i/500D: From Snapshots to Great ShotsGGS DSLR LCD Optical Glass Screen Protector for Canon 450D / 500D / XSi / T1i

Reviews.Title: Perfect Pro/Am Camera
Reviews.Author: Cameron Sontag
Reviews.Content: I love the features and customization.  This replaced my Canon 35mm SLR bought 12 years ago, and like the rest of the world, I can't believe that anyone ever used film!Picture quality is excellent, focus and frame rate fast, design and screen are easy to use.Do not be lured by the HD video option.  This will not replace a good video recorder.  The system will not focus automatically, and the motors & drives make such a racket that any sound in the video is lost.If you want a great DSLR this is the best for the price!

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR!
Reviews.Author: M.N. "maddie"
Reviews.Content: I really like the canon t1i, it's pretty easy to use and it takes beautiful pictures....still learning so that i can take full advantage of all the features of the camera....but i do soooo love it!Do recomend!

Reviews.Title: GREAT camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Pawel A. Lach "paul"
Reviews.Content: I like everything about it. It is easy to use and gives the possibility to explore. I love taking pictures at night and using manual mode.If you are not an expert but would like to learn some photography I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great camera/lens combo
Reviews.Author: Steve Neighbors
Reviews.Content: Got this camera with the EF 55-300mm lens bundle as a present for my wife. She reviewed the specs before I made the purchase, so it wasn't exactly a surprise. But, she was definitely surprised at the quality and usefulness of the camera. She takes many pics of birds and other wild life, so is getting lots of use from the 55-300mm lens.A few days after the camera arrived, she saw the same camera, but with a lesser lens bundle, for more money at our local Costco.I was impressed with the very speedy and free delivery.Note I left some categories un-rated as we have yet to use those features.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic quality.
Reviews.Author: CharacterArtGuy "TKG"
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for a few days but the quality is wonderful.  I am a complete amateur at photography and this is our first DSLR camera but I must say that even on it's basic auto settings I have taken the best pictures of any digital camera I have used.  I can't wait to get into learning the advanced techniques with it.  It is high for the price but well worth it because like many other things you get what you pay for...  especially in electronic devices such as this.

Reviews.Title: Versatile and small
Reviews.Author: R. Abraham "Roje"
Reviews.Content: Great price for a 15meg camera, a good step up for a novice looking to get into the field of pohotography. It does take a little reading to really understand the features and functions of the camera. Guys with big hands be warned...get a grip :)

Reviews.Title: Good for beginners
Reviews.Author: Yanding Qin
Reviews.Content: I like this camera very much.The price is reasonable that I can afford, except that two weeks after my purchase, Amazon reduces the price, -_-|||.I have some experiences in photographing, so it is easy for me to get familar with this camera. The interface is not so beautiful with regard to other companies' DSLR camera. But in other words, the interface is quite simple, all the parameters are easy to read and modify.The images seem a little unsharp so I have to make some post modifications in photoshop.Another thing to remind is that, when taking pictures outside on a sunny day or inside where the light is bright the camera is prone to over expose the picture. I have to set the exposure compensation to -2/3, and will get better exposure.I have a canon hf s10 for taking videos, so I don't expect too much from T1i's video. In fact, the video is very bad compared with hf s10, especially when you have to change the focus. I just take some sample videos with this camera and never use its video function again.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever owned!
Reviews.Author: S. Grenier "Stay-at-home Mommy"
Reviews.Content: Forget about paying photographers to take your photos. This camera can do all and more. I played around with all the functions and hook it up to my photoshop and BAM! you got your self a flawless photo. Just like a pro! I'm a beginner and the functions and buttons this camera has confused me a little but after reading up and looking at some photos online and comments on some, I pretty much taught myself how to use it. No classes for me. =)

Reviews.Title: Great camera for point and shoot and serious hobbyists
Reviews.Author: photo hobbyist
Reviews.Content: The Canon T1i is a perfect camera for those who want the convenience of a point and shoot with the luxury of choices of lenses and the ability to add your own creativity when you're ready to explore exposure, aperture, and shutter timing settings on your own.  There are so many choices that a book to help you to understand them is helpful as well since the owner manual has the facts but not much on when to change the settings.  I'm still going back to the book a month later to remember how to use live mode or the blocked exposure feature.The only downside I've found is that Photoshop takes a while to process the 15.1 megapixel images, even on a new Macbook Pro but you can always change the size of the stored images.I also considered the Canon T2i but it wasn't readily available yet and the only difference in functionality that I cared about was better HD video which I don't use by default on a DSLR.You can't go wrong with the features in the T1i.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase for the $$$
Reviews.Author: Grant Langhus
Reviews.Content: I'm just another very satisfied customer.  I did about a month of research both online and speaking in person with experts before I selected the T1i (500D).The reason I purchased this camera, as opposed to another make/model:--> 1080p, and superb 720p video--> Interfaces (HDMI, etc)--> Selection of lenses--> Live View--> 15 MegapixelsI highly recommend this camera, especially to beginners, if you are looking for an affordable, feature-rich camera from an industry leader and don't mind the APS-C size image sensor.UPDATE:Two and a half years (and 70,000 pictures) later, I still love this camera.  It's been everywhere with me, through rain, mud, snow, and does an amazing job.  The only thing that really bugs me is that it only does about 3 frames per second, and is a bit noisy at 1600 ISO.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: S. Nehring
Reviews.Content: I had wanted a dslr for several years. After months of researching, I decided on the T1i and am glad I did. I'd suggest adding a battery grip which gives you extra battery time and makes the T1i feel nicer in the hands. (the hand grip on the camera itself is small and can be uncomfortable) A class 6 memory card is a good idea if you'll be shooting video.

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR camera very easy to use
Reviews.Author: Dustin Mcclure
Reviews.Content: We bought the camera kit off of eBay with Squaretrade warranty for less then (...) using Bing Cashback so I got an outstanding price right off the bat.As far as the camera goes; it takes great pictures as far as I can tell. I'm not professional; I just wanted a camera that would get the shots of my 3 year old daughter and this does it pretty well. We put the pictures on my 55in lcd tv and blew them up to 200% and still didn't notice any pixelazation on the focus point. The camera controls are very easy (except for autofocus on the video); the speed of the camera is awesome (highly recommend the Sandisk Extreme 30mb/s SD card); overall very satisfied with the camera. My only complaint is that it does not accept Compact Flash which are cheaper and capabale of higher write speeds.One other thing that I'm not really happy with is the video; but I bought this as a camera not a HD video camera. I turned off the auto focus because you could here the motors in the video; but I couldn't manually focus quick enough to keep up with the video. Again keep in mind; this is a camera; if you want an HD video camera look at the Sony HCX.

Reviews.Title: Exeptional quality at an exeptional price.
Reviews.Author: Luis Vegas
Reviews.Content: My experience with canon's t1i has been simply outstanding, the camera is light, portable and  shoots great quality photographs. It doesn't perform as well in low light settings, but with the right lenses and technique it can be improved, battery life is normal, so I suggest purchasing a battery grip for those photographers who do spend lots of time on the field. Overall, I recommend this camera completely, its an incredible camera at an amazing price.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Joan Spinner
Reviews.Content: I'm still working on learning all the features but even just with the fully automatic is is great. Any SLR takes some time to learn but I can't fault the quality of the pictures. Auto focus is the only thing I'm not totally pleaed with because it will get confused at times and start going back and forth so you loose the shot or switch to manual and the ring is a bit small for accurate focusing.

Reviews.Title: Canon powerhouse
Reviews.Author: Bleedblue "Love to shop"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a month.  Took it on vacation in Lake Placid, the photos were amazing.  Used mostly auto feature and they are like professional pictures.  Haven't tried the video part but a couple times, but know it will work well. Definitely get the generic battery rather than the actual Canon one, works the same. A superb camera just will take time to understand all features.  Did get another manual for it that has more details than the one it came with.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Wm A. King
Reviews.Content: The Canon T1i is an exceptional camera.  I own both the 50D and the T1i.  I bought the camera for my wife as an introduction to DSLR and I find my self using it as much as she does. Although there is a great deal of work to be done on the focusing during video capture feature, Canon has raised the bar pretty high for an entry level unit.

Reviews.Title: Great high end camera for the amature
Reviews.Author: G. Stant
Reviews.Content: I am now just returning to the SLR type of camera after many years of using a simpler point and shoot type. My current point and shoot camera was a Canon, so I began my investigation with the Canon line of dSLR cameras. My first effort was to go by the local "brick and mortar" stores to get some "hands on" feel. After looking at a variety of other cameras, it soon became evident that the T1i was the camera that would best fit my needs as a very active amateur photographer. The factors that caused me to choose this camera: very good feel in my hand; easy to see and to use controls; a very large 15.1 MP picture size; 3.5 fps speed which fit nicely into the type of pictures I wanted to take; a good price point to reenter the SLR arena; Canon's reputation in the dSLR field; my experience with former Canon cameras as well as with a currently owned Canon HD movie camera; the availability of a large variety of Canon lenses as well as their prices. In the 30 days that I have owned this camera, I have taken over 1,200 shots. The camera has lived up to all of the expectations that I have come to expect from Canon cameras and look forward to using this camera for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: Great and Perfect pictures
Reviews.Author: Joe F
Reviews.Content: I am new to DSLRs. This is my first one and the photography books helped me to understand the product and how to take good pictures. This camera is awesome. It is all I was looking for. I have a long way to go and the camera is going to help me learn Photography.Since I am new to DSLRs, I can't compare them to others. However, this one does a lot better than my Sony Point-and-Shoot (obviously not something to compare). A few things about the manual though. The manual doesn't really give you a lot of information. It wasn't very useful. If you have books on photography, it will help you understand each and every part of the camera and how it operates. Awareness is the key and I suggest you read through a few photography books before you start. The manual will just help you assemble the product together but if you want great pictures, you need a book on photography (again obvious i assume).Love it and I will recommend it to anyone interested in Digital SLRs.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Cooper "hoosiergurl"
Reviews.Content: This is my first SLR and I'm sooooo happy!  Before I used a decent point and shoot cam which i thought was great till i started taking pictures with this camera wow total difference from day one!  I was missing a lot of shots due to the point and shoot taking forever to decide to take the pic and now with this i'm actually getting great shots of my 2 year old who doesn't like to sit still!  She likes the picture sound and the flash makes her laugh so it's a win win situation for me.  I don't know any of the technical terms i just know that i got a great camera that came in the mail today that works wonderfully!  I have nothing to compare to since i've never used one before.  I do know the live view rocks, i took pictures of my cat and didn't use a tripod and it came out awesome so was quite pleased with that and then took pictures of my daughter and that was awesome so now the test will be this upcoming sunday at a family gathering and my daughters first christmas program at church (low lighting and all) so we'll see!  can't comment on the video have yet to try that out.update:  the pictures at the church were awesome and I couldn't be happier with this camera.  I have gotten quite a bit of use from this camera and think this was a perfect investment in recording my daughter's memories!

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Lampton "Crafty Mom"
Reviews.Content: I have owned several digital point and shoots.  I was sick of missing shots while waiting for it to focus etc.  So I took the plunge and bought a "real" camera. This things is fast!  I can finally get true candid shots of my kids and pets...the colors are vivid and the settings are easy to learn...even for me!

Reviews.Title: Better Than Expected
Reviews.Author: Mike in STL
Reviews.Content: I own two Canon point and shoot cameras which take great pictures. However, this camera is in a whole other league. It is also quite an improvement from film DSL's of the 80's. I also bought the EF-S 55 250  mm zoom lens with the $[...] instant rebate. I find myself using that lens more than the kit lens. Both take great pictures. I'm amazed how much I can crop and keep the picture sharp up to ISO 1600. I bought this camera so that I could take rapid pictures of my 3 grandkids. The burst rate with the built in flash is good and it is really fast without the flash. I'm amazed how many pictures I'm taking. I use a Class 4 PNY 8GB HC memory card. It can handle large fine JPEG Burst shots with no problems. I'm not sure how it would handle video or RAW plus JPEG. My friend has a $1500 EF lens which is clearly sharper than the lenses I purchased. That will be by next upgrade. Buy it, you wont be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: Third Canon DSLR
Reviews.Author: E. J. Deangeli
Reviews.Content: I needed a smaller camera body for my kayak trip to Costa Rica as my D bodies are too large. The T1i takes all of my lenses,which are fairly large and gives me much smaller package.I have taken about 100 shots so far just to check out the various modes and so far so good. I have not been that impressed with the picture quality thus far with many shot a little over exposed. This was in comparison with my D20 and D40. I will be in a much better position to comment after I return from from my trip.Jay D  Canon EOS Rebel T1i 15.1 MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera with 3-Inch LCD (Body Only)

Reviews.Title: You won't regret buying it.
Reviews.Author: MagnumPI
Reviews.Content: I was looking to upgrade from my Canon S70 to an SLR for quite a while. Originally was looking at the XSI, then the XTI, but when the T1I came out, my search was over. It had all of the features that I was looking for. I am VERY pleased with my purchase!! It is a great camera for someone that is new to SLRs. There is a learning curve if you are moving from a point and shoot, so don't be discouraged by reviews that say the camera is too complicated...it's like driving a car with a manual transmission after having only having automatics. I haven't spent too much time with the automatic modes on this camera for the simple fact that SLRs are designed to give YOU the user more control over the camera.  I have spent most of my time using the AV, TV and M modes to learn and fine tune exposure. I traveled both to Europe and South America multiple times, and I hated that my point & shoot couldn't capture the scene the way I wanted it. Pictures were either under exposed, over exposed, or couldn't be framed properly because of the focal length of the lens. I can't wait to use this on my next vacation. The HD Video is good, but I mainly use this for taking pictures. I would have purchased a video camera if I were mainly focused on shooting video. This is a very versatile camera. IF you are disappointed by the quality of your pictures after buying it, I would highly recommend you join a local photography group to learn more about SLR photography and how to configure your camera. I would also recommend the Canon ef-s 55-250mm lens and the ef 50mm 1.8 lens.

Reviews.Title: Best entry level DSLR
Reviews.Author: C. Quinn
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera!  The pictures are very sharp and colors are amazing.  I only have the kit lens and so far, I am really happy with the quality of the pictures.  This is my first DSLR camera, and I purchased this one because of the HD video recording capability.  I use an 8 gb Sandisk Extreme III SDHC with it (as recommended by another reviewer) and I have not had any problems with video recording or playback.  I do suggest using a Speedlite 430EX with it if you intend to take a lot of indoor pictures or anywhere where there is poor lighting.  The flash on this camera is powerful but can only do so much.  I borrowed one from a friend and my pictures came out better with the Speedlite.  As long as you don't use live view, battery life is great.  I was able to take pictures and videos all day long (about 12 hours) at Magic Kingdom without having to change the battery.  If you are thinking about getting the XSi, get this one instead.  It is a much better deal for a couple hundred more.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: 2dogmom "2dogmom"
Reviews.Content: This is my first SLR after owning/using a few Canon point-and-shoot cameras. I love it! The HD video is a great feature and it's a great camera for an amateur photog like me who just wants to get the best quality shots possible and have room to grow.I plan on having this camera and enjoying its wonderful features and beautiful photos and video for many years to come. Great investment if your photos really matter to you (i.e. your kids, your pets, special occasions, vacations, etc.)You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Canon T1i
Reviews.Author: J. Thomas
Reviews.Content: Torn between this entry DSLR and the equivalent Nikon.  Decided on this for the auto LCD shut-off, the slightly better pixel count.  The rap on this camera is the noise factor after ISO 400. This is the rap on every camera.  The pictures I have taken up to ISO 1200 are usable (with a little help from Photoshop. All and all a good DSLR.  I am happy with purchase.  Would recommend getting another battery and the Canon battery grip which offers an alternative placement on the shutter button.

Reviews.Title: you'll like this camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher Ciaffa "cwc983"
Reviews.Content: This camera is really good.  The lens that it comes with provides clear pictures.  I'm an amature photographer and i'm really still trying to learn how to fully use it and i learn  things every time i use it.  I still can't get over the quality of the photos that come out of this camera.  I went boating with friends not to long after I got it and I was taking pictures of them tubing and 99.9% of them came out looking beautiful.  I even took a video with the camera and even with the bumpyness of the boat the video was awesome and it captured the sound of everyone on board.  If your looking for a awesome camera for the money this is your camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Matte
Reviews.Content: This camera is great - it take wonderful pictures.  Easy to use and the price was right.You get a good lens with purchase.The HD videos are nice but they do come through rather large.  But I am still learning on if and how I can size them down.This camera is also great if you have active children.  My 3 year old is very active and always on the go.  Now that I have this camera she is not a blurr.  And I have some great action shots.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T1i
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  This Canon takes great pictures and it is nice that the lens is sold with.  The HD Videos with the camera are very large (I still have to learn how to size them down).  This is a great buy and a great camera.  My pictures are no longer blurry when taking a picture of my very active 3 year old.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: AlabasterSong
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome.  Took it out of the box, loaded my card and bam...taking great pictures.  The clarity is incredible.  Right now I am taking everything with the autofocus which works great.  I can't wait to see what cool stuff I can do when I learn to manually do somethings.  One thing that I did play with is the shutter speed...I took a picture of my floor fan that was running at high speed.  The picture clearly showed the fan blades (no blur nothing).  The picture made it appear that I took a picture of the fan when it was off.  How cool is that?

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've Ever Had
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted to bring higher quality images to my web development business.  What I got was so much more.  I've purchased two additional lenses in addition to the one I got with the kit, one telephoto and one standard 55mm at f:2.8, and it seems that my shots are getting rave reviews.  I've had people asking me to do personal photo shoots of them because of the clarity and depth of my images.  i give a little credit to my own point of view in picture taking, but I've got to give a lot more credit to the T1i and lenses.The versatility in being able to allow the camera to do all of the work for you in the auto mode vs. having the power to take over yourself in order to get just the right shot is so easy yet powerful in the set of tools that are offered through this camera.  I also really like having the option of switching types of pictures, i.e. color vs. monochrome...it's a dynamic camera to say the least.

Reviews.Title: Living Up to Expectations
Reviews.Author: T. Meng
Reviews.Content: Even though I am biased, being overenthusiastic after a few years without a decent camera, I still believe I can fairly say that the t1i does a great job with the pictures.I would mostly consider myself an above-average amateur. However, I do know what feels right. The t1i takes great photos and makes it feel easy. Controls need some getting used to (I stumbled upon the Live View feature because it's kind of hard to find, and then had to figure out how to Auto Focus using a different button than when using the viewfinder), but other than that, the buttons are very intuitively placed. The auto focus in Live View mode is harder to use, however, as it is placed on the back of the camera and also seems slower to me than the regular autofocus. Adjusting ISO, aperture, and lens time in the Live View window is no problem, and makes using the t1i a blast.  I also really wished that Canon would follow Nikon in putting in a swivel screen so that you could get better angles, especially since the t1i relies heavily upon that one Live View screen (something to expect from future cameras).Although on the soft side, the images were very detailed at 15MP (large) and even tolerable on small size. I don't know if they'd be detailed enough for prints, but I'm sure with stitching, HDR, and all that sharpening hocus pocus in Photoshop, I expect you can get better results. The images do swell for desktop wallpapers on my 15" Mac, but that's not saying a whole lot. They said that the t1i would have issues with noise, but I don't really notice a lot (maybe the noise is degrading the sharpness?).As for movie mode (which I plan to use just as much as the photo capabilities), it works fairly well. There is rolling shutter issues that happen with most CMOS sensors or whateva (like the d90), but it's only an issue when you're full on whipping the camera (not when turning). My biggest complaint would be the microphone, which is mono, and the lack of a mic jack, which is suckable. The mic picks up every single sound, even when adjusting focus on my Tamron lens manually. I would not use it for moviemaking or documentaries by any means, where sound is important (unless you have some other equipment that I would love to get my hands on). However, this is not so much an issue for me, as I like putting tracks over my video (music videos and such).All in all, great camera for the price ($808 when I bought it). The t1i works for all my needs and a little bit more. I still have stuff to work out (exposure bracketing), but I don't think I missed out on too many other features.P.S. I was considering the d5000 and the pentax k-7 as well.

Reviews.Title: An amazing camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Kelly
Reviews.Content: This camera is simply amazing.  The lens is, well, usable until a good lens can be bought.  ISO's up to 3200 are surprisingly clean of noise.  I haven't tried the 6400 and 12800 settings yet.  Color is vibrant and real.  Controls are easy to use and conveniently located.  It replaced my 5 year old Rebel EOS 300D and frankly there is no comparison.  I usually shoot in RAW format and use a SanDisk 4 Gig card.  It's surprisingly fast.  The only disappointment is that the RAW files are not compatible with Photoshop.  They must be converted by the Canon EOS Utility program (included with the camera) before being able to open them in Photoshop.  This is a real production problem.  The conversion process is painfully slow - 100 photos can take the better part of an hour to complete the conversion (which is done automatically with the click of a button).  Other than that (which isn't really a reflection on the camera - just on Canon and Adobe), this is a great camera!  I recomend it to anyone not looking to buy the 5D Mk II.

Reviews.Title: Much better than my XTi
Reviews.Author: Adam Boutin
Reviews.Content: This camera performs much better than my Canon Rebel XTi, which I upgraded from.  Image quality is better, buttons are laid out more intuitively, and the LCD screen is amazing.  I have had the camera for a month, and I have been very happy with the pictures and movies I have taken.

Reviews.Title: Loving My DSLR
Reviews.Author: Steven Reiss
Reviews.Content: I've finally made the leap from my point-n-shoot to the DSLR world - and I'm loving it!First of all, the picture clarity is fantastic! Worlds apart from the old camera. The lighting that this camera gets in low light situations is dramatic!  No real need for me to adjust pictures to be "lighter"...I still have a long way to go in learning all of the tricks and techniques that this model has to offer.  I have tried the video feature and it is also top notch as well.Very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful for the price
Reviews.Author: Amy Giang "gianga"
Reviews.Content: The only two things I can think of that is not ideal on this camera is as follows:1) They don't include an hdmi cable in the box, which would be really helpful and convenient.2) It was weird that the record button for the video is not the shutter button. I kept pressing it and realized it was not recording.Other than those, I am enjoying this camera a lot!  It takes wonderful pictures and the size is perfect to bring around.

Reviews.Title: A great upgrade from my Rebel XT.
Reviews.Author: A. Huang
Reviews.Content: I am really happy with my purchase.  Better resolution, better image quality, beautiful and bright hi res LCD, live view, HD video, etc.  I was partly attracted to the T1i b/c of it's HD video capability.  I read some negatives regarding it such as poor 1080p video and poor sound quality due to the stock mic.  I did not intend on getting this to replace my camcorder so it has been just fine at 720p for quick clips in between pictures.At the recommendation of another reviewer, I bought the SanDisk Extreme III SDHC from the start and haven't had any issues.

Reviews.Title: First DSLR camera
Reviews.Author: nctvi
Reviews.Content: I've had the Canon T1i with 18-55 mm lens for about eight months and am very pleased with it.  The quality of the printed pictures are very good.1.  The picture images are not as super sharp as I would have expected with a much larger camera sensor.  I print on a Canon Pro9000 Mark2 (very high quality printer). I think it may be the lens (based on other reviews) and the image stabilizer.  I do a good job of holding the camera still in my hands.  Since I turned off the IS, the sharpness is better.2.  The LCD screen is out of this world.  It is so great to see the quality of your picture on the LCD screen, ability to zoom the image, and get the WOW factor from family and friends that look at the picture just taken.3.  The camera manual needs to be supplemented by 3rd party Canon T1i books.  They really helped me to get better use and understanding of the camera.4.  Battery life is great.5.
