Using a Class 6 SD card means there is virtually no wait time to see the picture just taken.6.  Continuous shooting in the Sports mode is incredible - it just keeps shooting.7.  The flash is strong and great for sunny/shady outdoor shots.8.  The placement of controls and buttons takes getting used to as it is not intuitive.9.  I like the viewfinder, but find the picture taken is a larger area than seen in the viewfinder.10. Overall, I am very pleased with the Canon T1iCanon now sells the T3i, so these cameras quickly go out of style, but I plan to purchase a longer telephoto lens for this camera in the next year or so.  If the camera lasts three years, I'll be happy with it.2 Year Review - Canon T1i still works great.  Have bought 55-250 telephoto and 40mm prime lens.  As a pro-am photographer, I like to fiddle with all the controls, but recently have been using Auto Mode and it produces the best overall pictures for family and informal scenes.  When the time is right, I will buy another Canon DSLR.  Extremely pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Even more affordable quality with time...
Reviews.Author: B. Harris
Reviews.Content: I've had my T1i for a little over a month now, and I love it.  It's an entry level DSLR, but for someone like me who's just now getting back into hobby photography, it's PERFECT.  Along with general scenery, portrait, and product photography (the reason I got it), I've been experimenting with time-lapse, night photography, extreme panoramic, and HDR photography... Stuff I couldn't touch with my point-and-shoot.  It's a blast!As the T2i and the T3i improve the market, the T1i becomes continually more affordable with time, and is a great opportunity for anyone looking to step up from the point-and-shoot market.My only complaint is that the "kit lens" is not particularly good at anything... Jack of all trades, master of none.  It takes decent shots through the spectrum, but doesn't really shine brightly anywhere.  I'd suggest looking into an additional lens (the 50mm prime is a great option) or getting the "body only" t1i and choosing a lens that really caters to your style and has good reviews.

Reviews.Title: well-made
Reviews.Author: Great Guy
Reviews.Content: This is a well-made camera with most of the features I could have asked for and more. The ability to go full-manual is very important to me, as sometimes manual gets better photos than full-auto. But the opposite is also true is certain situations! That's the beauty of digital technology. If one photo doesn't work, take another one with different settings!For intermediate photographers like me this camera is perfect. However, there are 2 cons:1. The f-stop does not go low enough. f-stop allows for making the background blurry while focused on the foreground, without having to zoom in too far. But with this camera and it's lens, you have to zoom in most or all of the way in order to do this fancy trick.2. The flash is only adequate for nearby objects.For both cons above, you can compensate by buying an external flash (expensive) and a better lens that can zoom in further.But for my uses I didn't really need to make those extra purchases, and you can still get very high-quality photos. And the video feature is excellent, as you can record fairly good quality video.

Reviews.Title: This thing is unreal..... and then some
Reviews.Author: John R. Callahan
Reviews.Content: All of the positives listed by other reviewers are true, however no one has mentioned in detail about the awesome software included with the camera.I do a lot of portrait photography and the best thing BY FAR about the camera is the ability to remote shoot through your computer.You can do everything you can do on the camera on the computer remotely. The nice thing is that you can see what you're composing and shooting on a nice big computer screen. This is important when you need to be sure that you're pictures are right, and RIGHT NOW! This is very valuable if you need to shoot a lot of pictures, as the pictures will be downloaded right to your hard drive as you're shooting. Also, in live mode on the camera, not only do you have a small screen to look at, but the batteries will die pretty quickly even using the battery grip because the screen being on constantly uses a lot of power. If you activate live view from the computer and not the camera, the screen on the camera stays off. HINT: if you do live view shooting, set up quick focus. Don't bother with the live view focus, it's lame.From the computer you can focus, shoot, and change all the camera settings! That ROCKS.Also included are other great software programs to download and edit RAW files. Also some simple software to post process your work, however if you're serious, you need to use the newest Photoshop or something similar that has a lot of horsepower. The Canon software plays real nice with Photoshop.Now I'll say this, to use the software it's going to take a LOT of reading and experimenting. It's all SIMPLE to learn, but learn it you must. The included software is the exact same stuff included in the high end Canon Pro models. There are very few pro features that can not be used with this camera.I can't believe you get so much quality and value for the money.The only real difference between this and the higher cost pro units are things like waterproofing, better lenses and internal components that are rated in the millions of operationss instead of the hundreds of thousands, and burlier construction. But hey, you're not spending $2000-30000 here either!Slap a good lense on this camera and I guarantee you that NO professional would no the difference between the pictures taken on this camera and one costing $1000 more.

Reviews.Title: Cannon for Life
Reviews.Author: J. Rotondo "MisterJoe"
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR.  I am not even an amateur photographer. I'm green as it gets.  I was trying to pick between a Nikon D90 and this camera.  In the end it came down to comfort.  The cannon felt more ergonomic and a little more user friendly.  Though I can't tell you much about the infinite features this camera has, it has already been a pleasure to work with. I purchased it with the Cannon 17-55mm lens and the picture quality is fantastic!  Even in auto focus mode the pictures are so crisp and the colors so vibrant I am thrilled with the camera. I'm excited to learn more about the more advanced features of this camera, but as a novice I'm already having a great time and taking pictures I'm thrilled with.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: Kevin J Friesen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera over the XSI, thinking that I liked the 15.1 megapixel rating.  After receiving the camera and using it, I'm impressed with the clarity and size of the screen, the quality of pictures, and  all around functionality of the camera!  I would encourage the T1i for any young aspiring photographer!

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR for a great price!
Reviews.Author: Lumpa
Reviews.Content: The new Rebel T1i is Canons first DSLR camera to feature HD video. The camera is a great DSLR to use for a great price. It includes all of the standard DSLR shooting modes and has an easy to use interface.Ease of Use: The Rebel T1i falls in line with other 'starter' DSLR in the Rebel series. All easy to use, with buttons and a navigation menu that is logical. No need to read through a manual to figure out how to operate in different modes, most standard functions are self explanatory.HD Video: New to the Rebel series the T1i features HD video, with liveview so you can video by just looking at the screen.  The HD video is at first difficult to find how to use, the manual explains clearly what needs to be done. The video is not perfect and does not have many features besides, but for the price and the first release of video for a DSLR it is a wonderful function to have.Kit Lens: Surprisingly the Canon lens that comes with the camera is perfect for beginning photography, and when ready a more advanced lens can be purchased. The 18-55 lens does the job for standard pictures of friends and at family gatherings. Though the aperture is not great, for the price it does the trick in low light settings. If you plan on using the camera for good close ups, a telephoto lens will need to be purchased.If you are wondering if its worth purchasing the top of the line newest Rebel, versus buying an older model. The T1i is worth the little extra cash. With a larger CCD sensor and HD video, it is well worth it and something that can be used for life.

Reviews.Title: Price Performance Ratio is Really Good! Great Camera
Reviews.Author: David Watts
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a Canon XTi to the T1i.Is there a radical difference in quality? Frankly, no. I've very successfully enlarged my XTi 10.1 megapixel images to 20" x 30" at my local Sam's Club and they are very clean (taken at 100 iso). Will the 15 megapixel enlargements to 20" x 30" be any better? Perhaps - but will it really be noticeable? Probably not.But, there are some real reasons to upgrade:Much better noise control. The noise at 400 iso on the T1i is probably like the noise at 200 iso on the XTi, 800 on the T1i is probably like 400 on the XTi, etc. So much better noise control is great.The additional options on the self-timer setting is nice. The T1i allows you to tell the camera to wait 10 seconds before shooting, but also to take a prescribed number of shots in a row - perhaps 2, perhaps 6, or even 10. Quite nice if you're trying to put yourself in a group picture - the camera will happily fire off 10 pictures in a row.Auto exposure compensation is a bit easier to set.The menus are easy to work with - better than the XTi.The screen is much better. Its larger size and better resolution really helps you review photos.I propose that a great photographer will get great photos out of either the XTi or the T1i - and the quality will not be particularly noticeable even when enlarged to something like 20x30. And of course a bad photographer will get bad photos out of each camera.So, upgrading is a great thing if there are some bells and whistles that make your life easier.Don't upgrade because of the difference between 10.1 mp and 15 mp. It really won't make a big difference in all likelihood.Don't upgrade just for video. The video quality is nice, but its pretty tough (at least for me) to get any video that's really good. Possible? Yes. But I'll probably have to work quite a bit harder than I want to.When all is said and done, the price/performance ratio is really good on this camera. Great performance at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Unsatisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: Justin Hoskins
Reviews.Content: I purchased a camera from this place. The camera was shipped in a box and then double-bagged, no packing peanuts. It didn't come with a manual or lens cap. The memory card was full with someone's pictures. I used the camera two or three times and then it quit working. I contacted the seller and he told me to contact a local photography shop for a charger. I had already purchased a charger, but I went and bought another charger just in case. Guess what the camera still didn't not work. I asked for a refund and received a response from Amazon but none from seller. After a week or two Amazon decided to refund my money. The seller response is as follows:PHONES AND COMPUTERS ON SALE - Amazon Marketplace nlp0ddgfjcy01jz@marketplace.amazon.com8:24 AM (12 hours ago)to meOrder ID 002-6604712-8303429:1 of Canon EOS Rebel T1i 15.1 MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera with 3-Inch LCD and EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS Lens [ASIN: B001XURPQS]------------- Begin message -------------can you please send me pack the phone since you got the full refundthats not the way to do businessyou have the merchandise and the moneyif i don't hear back from you ,i'll be contacting amazonthanks------------- End message -------------For Your Information: To help arbitrate disputes and preserve trust and safety, we retain all messages buyers and sellers send through Amazon.com for two years.  This includes your response to the message above.  Amazon.com uses filtering technology to protect buyers and sellers from possible fraud.  Messages that fail this filtering will not be transmitted.We want you to buy with confidence anytime you purchase products on Amazon.com. Learn more about Safe Online Shopping (http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?nodeId=10412241) and our safe buying guarantee (http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?nodeId=537868).In response I replied:To whom it may concern,I can't send back your phone, since I never received a phone. However, I can send back your piece of sh_t camera! I should send you software that has spell check because you can't spell either. I will also update how I was treated. You could have politely responded by asking for your camera back after Amazon made the decision. Instead you send me an email with an accusatory tone and threatening to contact Amazon if I don't comply. If you would read the "safe buying guarantee" that Amazon puts a link to on the bottom of all disputes, you would know that they keep a record of all messages in dispute.Thanks,Unsatisfied CustomerI will not purchase another item from "Phones and Computers" and highly to spend another dime on Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Faulty image sensor.
Reviews.Author: C. Griffin "Unhappy"
Reviews.Content: When I first received my t1i it wasnt packaged very well, there was a lot of room in the box and on the top of the box the one and only layer of tape was broken. Now I'm not entirely sure if it was because of the poor packaging or because of faulty hardware but the camera didnt work properly. the easiest way to explain the fault was it looked like a dead pixel on an iphone or lcd monitor except for it was redish/orange square. it was on every video I captured. had it for less than a week sent it back yesterday.

Reviews.Title: It's not "all that"
Reviews.Author: Arcadian
Reviews.Content: Now, look here.  This review is for those who are frustrated by those perfect 5-star, happy go lucky, empty eye stare with a smile reviews that seem to go nowhere and suppress just about everything except a plethora of useless first impressions.  I've had this camera for 3 months now, and here's what I think:Images are way too soft - even with my Canon EF 28mm f/1.8 USM prime lens.  I tried increasing sharpness, but it makes images look slightly artificial, like they were sharpened by some primitive photo editing software.  You'd probably think I'm exaggerating, but no, the images are soft even with raised aperture.  I know some people don't mind, don't care or can't see when small details like blades of grass come out smeared in broad daylight (even with manual focus and a tripod with no wind and f8 or higher), but I do.  Damnit, man! I paid good money for this prosumer camera, and my friends old digital rebel (which I borrowed) beats mine on image quality.Why doesn't Canon just keep an 8MP sensor and improve pixel accuracy, instead? .  15MPs are just ridiculous, take up too much storage space and at least 40% of those pixels aren't even accurate, anyway.  You cant print 15MP on 4x6 print let alone an 8x10, and crops have too many artifacts unless you've been shooting with the flash.  Canon can you please offer us a non-consumer-zombie 8MP option?  I'll pay $500 more, seriously. It's not like glass lenses will ever produce that much detail without applying for a second mortgage to afford just one copy.But megapixels become a lesser issue when considering that the sensor seems to operate with a sort of threshold, requiring a certain amount of light to render somewhat noise free images with proper color and tonal range.  Not using the flash usually renders images slightly devoid of color, with pale facial tones and overexposed highlights, while shadows take on a tired brown or yellowish dark appearance if the threshold of lighting is not met. But this, however, is not an issue when shooting outdoors.ISO 800 and above adds a lot of random white (hot) pixels and general noise to the images, even in darker scenes.  It's really odd.  I never seen a digital camera produce so many of these bright, randomly placed dots.  Albeit, they are only noticeable when viewing images at 100% size.  Luckily, the hot pixels, though they can sometimes cover most of the image, appear in small enough amounts that a computer monitor/printer would not render unless it was cropped.Certain indoor fluorescent lighting will also drive the image sensor nuts.  If you find yourself shooting under certain compact fluorescent bulbs that have a yellow hue to them, game over man, game over.  Oh the horror of those skin tones.  There isn't a color in the spectrum that won't confuse the T1i's CMOS censor under this type of lighting.  I've had images where normal white skin tones were replaced with red, purple and even magenta, especially around the cheeks and nose.  It's just freaky.  And if the person has a tan, well then, you might as well draw a painting where at least your interpretation of colors might look more accurate. I'm just used to my old prosumer camera, and seeing this sort of thing just leaves me in despair.I rarely use the live mode for for several reasons.  For one, pressing down the shutter will not activate the autofocus during live mode. You have to press a different button in the back of the body first to get it to auto focus, then press the shutter.  The other problem is the that the pictures tend to come out shaky in live mode.  It might be the mirror which makes a loud clunky sound every time you take a picture in live mode.  All I know is that turning off live mode renders sharper pictures, tripod or no tripod.  Yes, it does offer a contrast focus option that keeps the mirror up, but it's soooo slow that it just isn't practical.The kit lens?  Never mind the kit lens, it's utterly useless if you're into getting very high quality images -- especially indoors.  The flash seems to help a little, but oh God this plasticky toy is just hopeless, and so it's in the box where it will stay until I sell this thing.  Indoor pictures with this lens are very soft and devoid of detail and natural color tones (flash or no flash), but that is expected from a kit lens.  Outdoor images that should show varying intensities of shadows come out black, while highlights are easily overblown.The camera body is well constructed and feels comfortable, but there is one minor problem.  The shutter button is way too small and hard to press if you have thick fingers.  It just looks and feels cheap to the touch.Don't get me wrong, it's not all bad.  You can get good images if you know how how to get around the T1i's weaknesses.  Why Canon keeps up with this higher and higher megapixel trend nonsense is obvious: public masses demand bigger this with more of that, and so I'll be taking the back seat on this prosumer zombie bus wishing for things like quality rather than quantity.  In vain, of course.Yes, it has oodles and oodles of options.  The 720p video feature is quite nice, though the 1080p is too jittery.  The interface is a delight to work with, and the LCD looks great.  The body is ruggedly built for a portable DSLR. It looks like it will last 15 years or more (not that I will use it for more than 2). But ultimately, it comes down to pixel accuracy for me.  And after 3 months of use, the T1i has delivered some decent images but nothing special, compared to my older cameras.  But it's certainly easier to handle day in, day out.

Reviews.Title: 5 star camera 1 star lens.
Reviews.Author: David P. Jones "DPJ"
Reviews.Content: The Canon T1i offers everything a pro needs at a price the amateur can afford. When comparing this to its predecessor, the XSi, the differences are subtle, but worth it. Most notably 15.1 MPs is a substantial improvement in resolution, but for most casual users not that noticeable. Unless you have a habit of cropping way down, or printing your photos larger than 16x20 you will not notice a difference. Especially on your computer. What the larger format does bring with it is the Digic 4 image processor. This is a fast and accurate processor that Canon is putting in a lot of their new cameras, even some of their compact P&S; cameras. On the T1i this processor works very nicely. There is virtually no need for White Balance or Level correction and it's fast and accurate when shooting action, low light, outdoors, or indoors. The one drawback with the 15.1 MP sensor is that there is minor spacing between the individual sensor pixels within the sensor. This is unnoticeable for almost everyone except the hard core photographer who like to zoom in and see the details at 2000x and they are willing to pay the extra 2 grand for the higher end camera.The T1i also boasts a higher resolution 3 inch screen over the XSi this is very nice for looking at your images. It shows even minor focus and blur issues that previously weren't detectable until you put your images on the computer. The T1i also has a live view button on the back of the camera which is nice for Macro shots and the movie mode is seen through the live view. As a photographer I look at the movie function as a salad with your steak. It's not why you buy the meal, it's just nice.The menus and button layouts are intuitive and easy to use. The various shooting modes are nice, but the real photographers will use the A, Av, Tv, and P settings. The T1i has a setting not found on the XSi called CA, which stands for Creative Auto. This is a photo for dummies setting. It allows for setting depth of field, exposure, and white balance correction from a simplified menu. This seems nice, but unless someone explains what these setting mean it's hard to do it with purpose. I guess with some playing around an amateur could figure it out. All of these features are comparable to the Nikon D90 which is the T1i's main rival. For those who are debating between the two it's all a mater of choice. The T1i is a little smaller and lighter and the menus are different. I personally like the Canon user interface systems better and thats why I choose the T1i. Also Canon lens' run cheaper and easier to find. I recommend going to a camera store and handling both, then come back to Amazon and buy here.With all that said the T1i's higher resolution, Digic 4 processor, and increased screen resolution are the reasons to buy this camera unless you have an XSi and then you will have to way out how much you would use the new features.Now the lens offered in the kit with the T1i is flat out useless. I would not recomend buying the kit, but rather buy the body only and a more versatile lens like the Canon EF-S 18-200mm f/3.5-5.6 IS Standard Zoom Lens for Canon DSLR Cameras. It may be $450 more, but you get a much, much better, more versatile lens.I am very very pleased with this camera and would recommend it to any novice, amateur, or student (I teach photography) who wants a great camera at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: Suprising
Reviews.Author: heyyou482
Reviews.Content: My last camera was a Nikon D80. I considered buying another Nikon, but the resale price vs technology level makes Canon appear to be a wiser choice. I was hesitant to buy because I'd never used a Canon. So, I went to snapsort.com and compared pretty much every model from every major brand that was in my price range. After a lot of debate, I settled for the T1i. I compared it to the T2i, T3, T3i, T4i, and T5i. Most of the improvements on the new models are things that I don't care much about or aren't worth the price increase to me (touchscreen, flip-screen, etc).Basically, I bought this camera because it had the following features over what I was comparing it to: higher resolution LCD, self-cleaning sensor, live-view, HD video capable, and a wide variety of cheap lenses. The only other camera that came close was a Nikon D3100, but the Canon won because its 50mm lens is cheaper than the Nikon's.

Reviews.Author: M. LeBlanc "JustMe"
Reviews.Content: I likED this camera other than it keeps falling apart.  We had the camera 3 days past a year (which we had a year warranty) and the lens quits working.  The auto focus wouldn't work and wouldn't allow me to take photos.  We sent the lens into Canon's repair center to have them repair the problem, which we had to pay full price for because our year warranty went out.  Then, 3 months later our flash wouldn't pop up or work.  It was right before our trip to disney and we didn't have time to send it in for repair so we bought a canon external flash (runs on batteries and they only last about an hour in the flash). 3 months later, (almost 6 months from sending our lens in) our lens quit working again.  Same problem.  We called canon's repair center and they said that our six month warranty - from having the lens fixed before - would run out in 4 days.  Yes, 4 days.  The guy told us to go ahead and send the lens in and they would repair it for free.  We sent the lens in and I received a price quote to have the lens repaired, but they had already told me they would repair it since it was the same problem and I called before our 6 months was up...well, they wouldn't fix the lens without me paying full repair price.  Canon repair center said that because they received the lens after the 6 months they wouldn't repair it for free.  They were going to charge me 110 dollars to fix the lens, but I can buy a brand new lens for 115 here on amazon.  I have three friends that own nikons and have never had any problems, so I'm just going to buy a new camera rather than spend 115 on a new lens and then another 200 on a flash.  We also owned the canon powershot and had to send it in to the repair center, so I'm officially done with canon.  I would have been happy if they would have just repaired my lens for me seeing how it was for the very same reason and I called 4 days before our 6 month cut-off.  I know that some people have great experiences with canon products and canon's repair team, but we have not.  =(

Reviews.Title: I Love This Camera!
Reviews.Author: Alicia
Reviews.Content: I've been saving up for this camera for awhile now. I just love the features, but I don't recommend this camera for beginners. I am a beginner myself, and I think that starters should take classes if you want to learn more efficiently. The shutter speed is just amazing and people seem to love the outcome of the picture quality. Although it is quite heavy, I just think it's worth it. I hope my opinion helps. Best of luck!~

Reviews.Title: Superb camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this camera before moving on, as usual, to the T2i and T3i.The only 2 significant minuses of this camera in comparison with the T3i to me are:1. no swivel screen2. in Manual mode, where you set the shutter speed and aperture, the 'auto' ISO is fixed at 400. Whereas in the T2i and T3i, the auto ISO is truly automatic (the camera adjusts it so you get a good exposure if you set ISO to auto).

Reviews.Title: Very good first DSLR!
Reviews.Author: James Harris
Reviews.Content: Purchased in late 2009 as a gift for the SO who had requested "a camera that would do HD video too". She uses it for snapshots (it is that easy to use)and short video and I use it for astrophotography, project documentation, and general photography.The video quality in full 1080p is slow at 20fps, as others mention. Also it eats Kingston SD's for lunch. I had it trash a brand new 16GB SD so bad it was worthless afterward... Could have just been a bad card, but others note the poor performance of Kingston SD in this camera too. Stick with the SanDisk SD and it is good.

Reviews.Title: Canon t1i
Reviews.Author: K. Porter "KP"
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing! It is easy to use and takes perfect pictures! I see alot of professional photographers use this same camera! I would 100% recommend it to anyone it is well worth the money and it is very durable.

Reviews.Title: T1 Rocks!
Reviews.Author: lrhamed "lrhamed"
Reviews.Content: Love the Canon T1i!  Very high picture quality, fast focusing, easy to use and a handy size.  This is my first DSLR.  At low ISO, can't detect any noise.  The main reason I bought this camera is picture quality.2/20/2011:  Update.  Using this camera to shoot weddings.  It makes me look pretty good with the pictures it takes.  There seems to be a bug in Aperture Priority mode where sometimes in choses a crazy slow shutter speed - but setting it to Manual and picking your own shutter speed resolves the issue.  Buddy and I were shooting an inside wedding reception - him with a Canon 40D, Canon 580 EXII flash, Canon 24-105L F4 lens, ISO400, me with Canon T1i 28-135 IS lens, Metz 48 Flash, IS0800 and to my eye, my pictures have less noise.  The image quality is great with both cameras.  The noise difference maybe due to his style of slightly underexposing and 'turning it up' whereas my style is to slightly over expose and 'turn it down' to avoid adding noise.  We both shoot RAW.Note to Canon:  Not a fan of large mega pixel cameras - their RAW files are HUGE - which make editing them take forever unless you have an fast laptop (which costs A LOT OF MONEY).  Would love to see you make a 10-12 megapixel camera with noise control as good or better than the Canon 5D MKII.  The Canon T3 may fit this request but wish it had wireless flash control and better viewing screen (and be cheaper).12/11/2011 update:  Recently got a Canon 60D and shot several weddings with it.  Must say, like the T1i a lot better.  60D has excessive color noise in RAW file.  T1i has much less color noise in RAW file.  I am able to get Beautiful Pictures from the T1i!  T1i is better behaved with noise at high ISOs.  Though handling T1i noise does reduce resolution, the T1i still makes beautiful pictures!  Routinely deliver photographs shot at ISO-3200 to the bride who is always quite pleased with the photographs from the T1i.  Have also shot horses barrel racing at ISO-6400 and 1/400 sec F2.8 at night in a poorly lit arena and gotten Very Good, detailed results without excessive noise.  May buy another T1i even though supposely it is obsolete.02/17/2012 update:  Doing my best to wear this camera body out by taking Lots of pictures with it.  Shoot a lot at ISO-3200 with good results.  Would not own a camera without ISO-3200 as it would cause me to miss so many shots.

Reviews.Title: Best picture and bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Abanquil Agbayani
Reviews.Content: Had the Nikon D5000 for a month  and it won't power on. Issues on this. Sending it to Nikon for repair.I  researched  for a small, comparable camera that is similar to Nikon as backup.  Found the T1i  a much better camera. Pictures are vivid than that of Nikon D5000 , just be sure to use only Lens with IS (VR, HSM or DC  features) for Canon doesn't have any built in stabilization in any new camera body.  I paired it to a Canon 24-70mm f/2.8 L USM Lens and a new  Sigma 18-250mm HSM lens and couldn't be happier.  My friends are envious including a neighbor that has a BULKY and butt ugly Nikon D90(looks old).  With d T1i's gorgeous 920k LCD lens for live view and superior pictures , I don't even want to touch my antiquated 230k LCD NIkon D5000 again.  The Nikon is going to ebay and my T1i is here to stay. See for yourself . The T1i is even better than the bulkier canon 50d wich has the same CMOS but lacks video.  Just use the right lens. I have been in photography for more than 20 years and can't be happier . Again get a good lens for this  amazing baby. Way to go Canon.

Reviews.Title: GREAT DSLR!!!
Reviews.Author: C. MacLeod
Reviews.Content: Extremely happy with this camera.  The LCD is awesome, bright, easy to read.  Camera features have everything I was looking for at this current price point.

Reviews.Title: Great stuff - Wife loves it
Reviews.Author: J. Taylor
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife because she had an old (1970s) Canon 35mm SLR that was having issues and starting to cost more to maintain than use.  We also had a few cheap point-and-shoot digitals, but they were never worth printing. My wife is loving the quality of picture that this camera takes.  I wouldn't say that we're professional photographers, but we found the size, shape and weight of the camera to be perfect for my wife.  She is still learning all of the ins and outs of the software, but the simple point-and-shoot modes work good and with her now delving into the manual settings, she has found that grasping the general photography concepts is easier with quick results to review.  I would recommend this camera because of the brand strengths and general ease of use.

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "kepela"
Reviews.Content: I like the ability to use one camera to capture both stills and videos, so I haven't purchased a digital SLR until now. WOW, I LOVE this camera. I've been using it with a cheap, generic 150x SDHC card and the multi shot mode shots so fast, it's like having movies... amazing.I understand that Canon does not include very good lenses with their kits, but this sure takes nice pictures, Way better than a good pocket digital camera. The colors are bright and true, even in low light and REALLY sharp and detailed. Movies in low light can be dark, but you can auto focus even in movie mode; and of course, since the zoom is manual, you can zoom in movie mode too.It's really easy to figure out how to use, manual or auto with all the special shot modes. I never opened the manual to set it up and start using everything on it.It's pretty small for an SLR and very comfortable to carry around.I thought the camera was pretty expensive. Some here say it's a good price; after using it I can easily see why.It is the easiest, more complete DSLR you can get for the money and I just love it. I'm so glad I decided to get it. You can't go wrong with a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Gadget Dad
Reviews.Content: I use to think that picture quality from subcompact camera are good enough and never understood why people would carry a bulk DSLR camera.  However, the picture quality is just unbelievable!  I don't understand all the different buttons and settings yet, but the pictures I have taken with the Canon Rebel T1i have been absolutely amazing!  If you have kids or if you are using a camera to capture special moments, then for a few hundred dollars more, you'll get something that you can really treasure forever!

Reviews.Title: Great camera - Could live without the video
Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: The T1i was a huge step up from my 300D but I could easily live without the video function.  It was down to this and the D5000 but I stuck with Canon due my limited bag of lenses and to the resolution on the screen.  My wife always wants to see the pictures as I take them so the better review screen is a big plus for her, and therefore me. I've already upgraded from my old non-IS USM lenses so I guess I could have bought the Nikon anyway. Oh well - it's a great camera but from all the research I did it seems like you can't go wrong with this, the Nikon or the E-620. The kit lens is very plastic-y - There wasn't a price difference between the kit and the body when I bought so I got the kit...if there is a price difference when you read this - don't waste your money on the kit lens.

Reviews.Title: This was a perfect gift.
Reviews.Author: A. Winstead
Reviews.Content: Sorry it took so long to rate but the camera was a graduation gift for our son and was given to him last Saturday.  The camera was just perfect and he loved it!  He will be studying for his Master's Degree at Hebrew University in Jerusalem this Fall and we look forward to receiving many photos of his adventure!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Joslyn Vosta
Reviews.Content: I wanted this camera solely for the video recording, and it works so well for all my video and photography needs!

Reviews.Title: Canon T1i
Reviews.Author: John pate
Reviews.Content: I love the canon 1i series. I bought the camera because I was borrowing a Canon Rebel T3i. I really liked the T3i and I love that you can interchange the lens within the EOS Rebel Ti series. This camera is a little different,but I like it.

Reviews.Title: Professional quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: I love my Rebel!!!  I makes everything easy.  The stills are crystal clear and the videos are high quality.  I cannot say enough about this camera.  I love shooting pictures at an all day event and then downloading them into my computer.  The features are too many to name but I think the Rebel does it All.  It is light weight and lenses can be changed in a matter of seconds.  I have had many cameras but now I am a Rebel fan for life.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: P. Mulloy
Reviews.Content: I have had SLR since the late 70s. This is my first digital SLR and I really like it. It is not a pro camera but it does everything I need it to do.

Reviews.Title: Love this Baby
Reviews.Author: devildogswife
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera new, in 2010.  I've won numerous Photography contests/Art Shows  with the images I capture with it. I have shot at least a half million gorgeous portraits over the years, and as I've grown as a photographer, this camera is still meeting my needs.  I have up-graded the lens, of course, over the years.  My images are sharp and clear, I can count on this camera to work when I need it to, it's  is light to carry, easy to manipulate, and goes everywhere with me.  I have not had a problem in 4 years; it works as well today as it did on day one.  A camera  "sees" only  as well as its operator does . A more expensive camera- doesn't give you talent.

Reviews.Title: A+++
Reviews.Author: Voodoo Eagle
Reviews.Content: a camera I use till today and perfect images for what I need.  does hold up very well to diff environments and quality pics.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Janelle
Reviews.Content: Really sturdy camera, I have had it for two years and taken it across the world and it is still working wonderfully

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Marcel Andrés
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived in perfect state. I'm very happy for this purchase. This is my next step equipment, after Xti and Xs. In few days, I've taken nice pics and video option is an plus.

Reviews.Title: This camara rocks!
Reviews.Author: Mom of 5
Reviews.Content: We bought this about 7 years ago, when the T1i was hot stuff.  I LOVE the pictures I have taken from this.  My photographer daughter who is now 19 LOVEs this camara with the macro lens.  In fact, she confiscated it.  I only get it once in awhile, when I can track her down.  Still working.  No issues.  No problems.  I love the everyday lense it came with.  Works for me.  In fact, we just bought the Rebel T5i, so MOM can now have a camara of her own.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Almonte
Reviews.Content: Great and excellent.. I'm very confortable with this and it works in an excellent way; perfect stuff and just awesome!

Reviews.Title: canon t1i
Reviews.Author: mulenga
Reviews.Content: I love it! Just as it was described! Thank sooo much! I just have to get extra items for it.

Reviews.Title: Show!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Gustavo
Reviews.Content: The item come perfectly and fast! Was not found no one problem with the item. was like described! Very good! Really like New!!! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Company
Reviews.Author: Gretchen McDonald
Reviews.Content: Easy to work with and fast to respond!!  We are very satisfied with our camera, and they helped us get back in running in no time at all.  Great customer serive and we will defiantly use them again

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: whitney
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing! The picture quality is exactly what I was looking for, especially for a beginner photographer. I am so glad that I purchased! :)

Reviews.Title: received quickly, works great
Reviews.Author: lureen ferretti
Reviews.Content: I received the camera quickly and it works great.  I looks almost brand new and came with a battery and charger.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Supacooldude
Reviews.Content: Great entry-level DSLR camera for people looking to make the jump to DSLR.  Easy to use and great to learn on.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Dakota
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on the camera. Not only saved a lot of money, but also takes brilliant pictures. Would buy it again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: A great camera!
Reviews.Author: Melissa Lesh
Reviews.Content: This camera has served me well for many years now. Even without a lens upgrade it takes great photographs and I use it for many video projects as well. A great buy!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for beginning
Reviews.Author: Manash
Reviews.Content: This is a nice DSLR camera for beginners like me. Reasonably priced and also I got it under some offer during thanks giving.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: muriel
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a few years now and just love it.  It is really time to upgrade, however, I am totally attached to this camera.  Once I upgrade to the T3i, I will continue to hold on to this for my back up.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a beginner getting in to DLSR photography
Reviews.Author: M. Filer
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this after having owned this camera for 2 years and recently upgrading to a T4i. The T1i was the perfect introduction for me to DLSR photography, and I would have no qualms about recommending this camera to someone looking to get into digital photography a little more seriously. All of the features and benefits of this camera have been covered ad nauseum by the other reviewers here. So I'll only say that the camera served me well in the 2 years I had it, it allowed me to grow and learn with it by providing most of the manual feature of advanced DSLRs, and I wouldn't hesitate to make the same decision again. Also, as a bonus: I was able to sell mine used on craigslist for about 80% of what I paid for it new on Amazon, and that's after 2 years of solid use! These things hold their value very well.

Reviews.Title: Agradecimientos
Reviews.Author: francisco villarreal
Reviews.Content: Muchas gracias por el envió. Muy satisfecho con el producto y contento, ya lo uso y cumple con las expectativas.

Reviews.Title: Fast delivery quality product
Reviews.Author: San  Dill
Reviews.Content: Ordered it on a Monday afternoon they had it to me on Wednesday afternoon, all the way from CaliforniaThey said the camera had a small scratch on the screen, I see no scratch and it's basically brand new

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS
Reviews.Author: Grandpa John
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Takes excellent pictures and makes it easy to crop or change settings if needed. Price was right. Use it a lot.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Knute Hammer
Reviews.Content: Meets my expectations for it's price range. Still learning how it works. Good entry level camera with a lot of automatic features. Learning curb is very easy for a beginer.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera.. i have had it for 2.5 yrs now!
Reviews.Author: s coe
Reviews.Content: Great camera.. i have had it for 2.5 yrs and its been dropped and even sat on and still works great.  I get a lot of compliments on my photos.. i highly recommend it !!

Reviews.Title: Bought this with/for my daughter--She LOVES it!
Reviews.Author: Tony Beach
Reviews.Content: My daughter researched for some time before arriving at this choice. She uses it for fun and in her high school photography class. All I've seen is perfect results . . . and I'm envious now. I have an older "next up" Canon 35 mm film camera which I've loved to death (before digital finally truly became of age). And I own, now, another similar quality Canon (but not SLR-type) digital camera. At the time I bought that one, sales people had recommended mine over this style--but I believe technology has come along since then (2008). From what I can tell, I'd highly recommend this one.One issue that we haven't figured out yet though: When using the flash, we haven't been able (as I can do on my digital Canon) to figure out how to turn off the pre-flash/red-eye option. Every time she uses the flash, we not only get one pre-flash, but seemingly two before the final flash goes off with the shot. I keep swearing there's gotta be a setting which removes that, but we haven't been able to find it yet. Hmmmmm.Otherwise . . . this is great camera!

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: JMB
Reviews.Content: For those of us who like having nice stuff but don't need the top professional grade equipment, this is the right camera for you. I have had if for about two years and have never had a problem with it. It takes great photos and works with an array of lenses.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera however I wish that I purchased one that was less bulky. The quality of photos are great, but it's not easily slipped into a bag and I'm always worried I will damage the camera. Kind of wish I purchased one of equal quality but more compact.

Reviews.Title: Awesome DSLR - my first
Reviews.Author: Dealzguy "Dealzguy"
Reviews.Content: I now use a 50D for last 3 years since I sold this Rebel, but more than many times have thought the XSi was sharper with the 18-55 mm kit lens than 50D with 18-135 IS lens I am using now. The kit lens was made in Japan (not Thailand as mostly the case is). The buyer on Craigs was offered full retail just because he wanted the Japan made lens. I miss it now...The T1i was my second purchase and very similar to 50D, so my comments are similar.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, Great condition
Reviews.Author: mallorybjordan
Reviews.Content: My camera came in perfect condition. I've worked with the t2i, but I think this works just as well. The pictures turn out beautifully and I find it easy to use.

Reviews.Title: real easy to use
Reviews.Author: Larry Poe
Reviews.Content: this has a phone camera beat all to hell , it makes me look like a pro at a very fine price

Reviews.Title: A Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Smitty
Reviews.Content: My purchase was for a gift for my Nephew who put items for sale on Ebay.  He was thrilled with the camera as a tool for Ebay and for Family event photography.

Reviews.Title: Wow, love it
Reviews.Author: Idaho113
Reviews.Content: As the title states i love this camera, i'm a newbie when it comes to cameras but i've always bought low end and never really liked the results. Every picture is crystal clear while just in auto mode and with accessories and bag everything was still under a grand, just gonna say you get what you pay for and this camera is worth every penny. I would recommend it to any family member or friend without regret. Thanks again amazon

Reviews.Title: if you want photography-like photos...
Reviews.Author: AKjonesy
Reviews.Content: This canon rebel is a good starter package. basically for people who want to upgrade from a smaller megapixel. This was a recnt bday gift from my boyfriend. he knew i love taking pictures. so he asked which camera i wanted. i went with this after deciding which one i wanted. I love my rebel! Perfect time because its fall time and all the changing leaves make a perfect candidate for taking photos. Soon after i learn more i will upgrade to a more expensive rebel.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel TI 15.1 MP
Reviews.Author: Arthur W. Greene "Arthur Greene"
Reviews.Content: Camera has met all functions that I need. Pictures are sharp. Built in flash works great. Ease of use and adapts to previous Canon lens.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for a couple years
Reviews.Author: arnp
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera with the kit lens a little over two years ago.  I never used the kit lens after initial practice resulted in poor results.  I did get a canon 50mm 1.4 and shot GREAT portrait photos.  Also purchased a Canon telephoto zoom 55-250mm 4-5.6 is and have gotten reasonable shots.  Outdoor shots have been best.  Indoor sporting activities are a challenge due to poor lighting.  Two weeks ago I was going to shoot some family members.  I took one photo and the display showed "Error 20".  I took the steps it suggested, called a couple local camera shops and ultimately was told it would have to go to the factory for repairs.  All cameras with a problem are repaired for a flat fee of $190 and returned with S&H; of $20.  Or they offer a Canon loyalty program to upgrade.  I did choose to upgrade at a good price to the T3i. I did like the T1i, but certainly expected it to last more than a couple of years.  Look forward to learning about my T3i!

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Compact in size but not in quality
Reviews.Author: Jody
Reviews.Content: Canon always offers the best bang for the buck.You usually get what you pay for but not with Canon.It is bottom price with great image quality.I've invested in a lot of Canon lenses and this is a great backup camera to my main 60D.

Reviews.Title: Lookin Good
Reviews.Author: AnnieRundle1222
Reviews.Content: I really like my new camera.  I will admit, it's a little challenging to use.  I worry that I really have no clue of all it's capabilities. So far I like the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Angus
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the quality of photos taken by this camera and the ease in using it! The camera was shipped quickly and was in excellent condition.

Reviews.Title: excellent!!!!
Reviews.Author: chago63
Reviews.Content: Excellente digital camera, i love it. the digital mode its easy tu use, the lens give you ideal aproch, take a few days to read the operator manual and make your excellent pictures

Reviews.Title: great..
Reviews.Author: elly
Reviews.Content: i just bought this item so far .. fast shipped and in great conditions .. can't wait to explore this camera..

Reviews.Title: Great for a novice photographer
Reviews.Author: St. Patrick's Day Mommy
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift from my husband for Christmas last year 2010 & it was immediately my favorite gift.  I love how quickly it takes photos, I now hate using my smaller point and shot and in fact don't even take it anywhere with me anymore.  My camera came with the EFT 18-15mm lens and 55-250 mm lens.  Photography has always been a passion of mine and this camera is allowing me to develop my skills much better than a point and shoot camera.  It's very easy to learn, but I would recommend getting a book besides the manual.  I love Canon cameras and plan to upgrade in a few years to a better DSLR once I have taken some photography classes and maybe start a small photography business.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Donna Marzigliano
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my step daughter. She just used it at a Taylor Swift concert and she got some amazing shots! Nice and clear. The instructions were easy for her to understand, and she's 15.

Reviews.Title: Happy Hobbyist!
Reviews.Author: Valorie Moses "Happy Val"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera.For this price and this performance, I don't think you can beat the value. Of course there are more expensive and higher performance cameras out there, but this is so great for a starter DSLR. Once I learned the functions of the camera a little better, the hobby bloomed and bloomed for me. I purchased some additional accessories, additional lenses, and a fun camera bag. I love that this camera also has HD video capabilities. That's a nice feature when you have kids or just simply like shooting videos. This was my first DSLR camera and I couldn't be more pleased. I have had it now for 2 years. One day I'll make an upgrade, but for now, this camera suits my needs wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: MTrimble
Reviews.Content: Everything was in mint condition, just as described in the review. The camera is excellent and all attachments provided are also in perfect condition. Thanks for the amazing camera!!

Reviews.Title: Great entry level camera
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I purchased this late last year in 2010 and have been using it for close to one year now. Although late to the game, with the release of the T3i this year, this camera still performs well and has held up great so far.

Reviews.Title: SWEET
Reviews.Author: Patrick A. Rochester "music lover"
Reviews.Content: For years I've had the EOSxt and wanted more pixel and a screen in the back that I could frame my pictures from, so when the T1i appeared I just jumped all over it. So far no disappointment. One Love One World.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Herrera "Amazon Freak"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, light weight, easy to use, nice menus and easy handle while taking pictures and managing the exposure and shutter speed settings.Highly recommend this camera with no cons

Reviews.Title: Sooo worth it for Refurbished
Reviews.Author: TheLatestech
Reviews.Content: I ordered this Canon EOS Rebel T1i from Canon, refurbished for about $100 less then the actually price. No Damage was made to it, and it's just like brand new!

Reviews.Title: Perfect starter
Reviews.Author: Ryan708
Reviews.Content: The ONLY complaint I have is the dial for selecting mode, does not go all the way around, making it take a second to go from movie, to manual mode. The LCD screen is increddible with it's 930,000 dots! Great pics, great quality.

Reviews.Title: Awesume
Reviews.Author: Eriquah
Reviews.Content: Got here just in time for me to snap photos for my 1st photography assignment.Love it...so far no problems.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: A. Schramm
Reviews.Content: I traded up from a Digital Rebel 300D -- the original Rebel (silver gray) -- that I have been using for eight years.I bought the "kit" because I wanted to try the IS lens and make it easier to sell the 300D with a lens. I also bought a battery grip and two after-market batteries and charger. Can't complain about the grip; it is just as well built as the Canon I can no longer use because it won't fit the newer cameras.Image quality is excellent. I shot a hand-held test: 1/30 sec at f3.5 (wide open) at ISO 800 and am very happy with the result. IS works. There is a bit of digital noise, but it is not objectionable. I plan to do additional tests with other lenses and some landscape shots. All those pixels should have a happy impact on landscape detail.I am not so impressed by Canon's raw processing software, but Adobe PS CS5 and Adobe Camera Raw 6.3 manage everything well. I like to shoot raw and these are big files. Use a fast SD card (at least a six, and better a ten). Files in PS are large when you are using either raw or fine jpeg -- 5184x3254 at 240 dpi is large file. Uses computer resources, and older systems may bog down. Something to think about if you plan to use this humdinger of a camera.I am happy so far; eight years of experience with the last Canon probably means I'll be happy with this one.Also, Samy's did what they said they would do. They shipped fast by FedEx ground without charge. I give them high marks, too.

Reviews.Title: very good camera
Reviews.Author: Mohammed.575
Reviews.Content: this camera is very good for those who wants to start exploring DSLR world. and for those professional photographers who are traveling and don't want to pick up their heavy stuff.I'm satisfied with my cam.. it's awesome. and the HD video is just great I love it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent DSLR for begineers
Reviews.Author: Pittya
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR and I am very happy I bought a canon. Really easy to operate. Pictures come out really nice. i bought this cam to capture my first daughter's birth and her first years. Excellent snaps.Pictures : the CA mode is the best. Anybody wanting to play with settings will really find this easy and fun.Video : initially I thought a DSLR with video recording facility that too FullHd will avoid carrying a handycam. But no. Use a dslr only for taking still images only. Though the HD video quality is nice but totally useless. The moment you zoom, the picture loses light and goes blur. Don't buy this Dslr for the video funtion.Overall excellent buy . Got an excellent deal where the 70-250 lens came for free. $200 savings. Amazon is the greatest.

Reviews.Title: i love my canon
Reviews.Author: mommacass88
Reviews.Content: couldn't be happier with it. everything came in the mail quickly with all of its working parts and it's a great camera. i'm a graphic design major and a photo minor and it's a great camera for all sorts of projects.

Reviews.Title: Canon Digital Rebel T1i
Reviews.Author: 64ragtop "satisfied customer"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a replacement for my Rebel DS6041 mostly because I wanted more speed in the multiple exposure mode, and compatibility with the lenses I already own.  The T1i delivers that and a larger viewing screen that includes the menus for setup, etc.  A BIG improvement! Also added features I won't be using.  If (or when) I want a movie camera, it won't be an SLR.  That minor gripe aside, I recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: splendid
Reviews.Author: Michael Israel "israelmaker"
Reviews.Content: i have never an SLR before and wanted one that i could use right off the bat and at the same time offered the ability to advance my skills as i got to know it better.  this is in incredible starter!  great picture quality and the HD video is amazing as well!  the sound for the video is also very good.  i can't really say i have one complaint for this camera..i would highly recommend for any novice user or someone who doesn't want to have to spend days reading a manual before they can start enjoying their camera.

Reviews.Title: Lightweight SLR for the Beginning Photographer
Reviews.Author: BookHeroine
Reviews.Content: As I have only had this camera for a few months and have yet to used every feature, mode, or nob, I will share the highlights I have found. Compared with other cameras I had had/used in the past, this is the most lightweight for an SLR. I had read that it was such, but until the body and lens were in my hands, I could not have fathomed the truth to that. It has made hiking with it on my back similar to carrying a couple apples.The body is so ergonomic, I am surprised that every friend who has tested it out can say the same thing. While holding the camera at the right angle, I can change the aperture without jeopardizing the framing. To save seconds like that while in a photo shoot can make a difference in reputation.My absolute favorite feature is the ability to take picture in very low light. Being able to keep natural light means so much!I have only used the video a few times, but I love what I have seen so far. The image quality is very clear. The only frustrating thing is zooming in or out of a shot. It makes a lot of noise that is picked up in the video.In all, I am very impressed with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: TNReader
Reviews.Content: I got several EOS lenses and a film-camera body in a divorce. I hadn't done much with that camera, but decided that I wanted to try photography. A digital camera seemed like a good choice. After playing with some simpler cameras, I decided to go for a more complex setup. Since I already had Canon lenses, I went for a Canon body that supposedly worked with the lenses. Surprise - this body does work with my old lenses!The camera is easy to handle and the buttons, dials, knobs, and screen are within easy reach. Charging and picture transfers are straightforward.I'm still learning to use all of the features and use the appropriate lenses, but I am very pleased. The pictures it takes are excellent and the Canon Web site has a wealth of hints and suggestions.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera, worth to buy it
Reviews.Author: Mahi
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after going through all the reviews and When I got this camera, After clicking the pics it made me so happy. The picture quality is very good.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Jacob H
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, takes great pictures and has multiple features. Service was excellent and the item arrived ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: Great first SLR
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Foote
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It doesn't have all of the bells and whistles of a 5D or a 1D, but it gets the job done and takes great pictures. Before buying the T1i I compared it with the T2i, and the 50D, both of which are quite a bit more expensive. I felt like I was "settling" for the T1i, and I was worried that I would wish that I had bought a more expensive body.I don't regret my decision at all, though. I have no complaints about the T1i - it has been wonderful. Unless you are a professional photographer I see no reason to get anything else.

Reviews.Title: Bill I
Reviews.Author: George W. Ireland
Reviews.Content: Bought for my son's digital imaging class at college.  This camera was minimum required, but son loves it.  Spent more for a Nikon for him, but he likes this better.

Reviews.Title: Great entry level dSLR
Reviews.Author: SMaes
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple of months now, and I've been very happy with it's performance.  It has all the features necessary to help beginners get great shots right out of the box, as well as the option to customize many of the core settings.If you stick to the preset modes, Portrait, Landscape, Full Auto, anyone can get great shots right away.  Once you've become comfortable with the camera the Priority modes (Aperture, Shutter, Manual) will allow you the freedom to setup your shots how you like.I've taken night shots, action shots, and portraits all with very good results. The bracketing mode allows you to capture 3 shots in a row at different exposure levels so you can choose which you like best, this feature is also nice to create HDR images from.  I set the ISO to it's lowest (100) for the night shots and the noise is low enough. I was not impressed with the LiveView shooting or the video, both features lack a true auto focus, but if you want to shoot through an LCD get a point-and-shoot. And if you want to record video get a Flip HD. Lastly, and to end on a high note, the menus are very easy to navigate and there's even a custom menu you can build of the settings you access most.You cannot go wrong purchasing this camera if you want great pictures from an easy to use dSLR.

Reviews.Title: I am a beginner to DSLR cameras and I love this one.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Adventurer
Reviews.Content: This camera was given to us as a gift and right out of the box we were able to start taking pictures that were of excellent quality. We are not in any way educated on how to take good pictures and have mostly experience with the standard digital camera...Sony cybershot, Kodak, and Polaroid's. After taking about 200 pictures that we think are great we began to read the instruction manual and found several other features that make the camera that much better. I can't wait to take pictures now, as I have a confidence that I will capture the moment the way it was and not the way the camera saw it. I would recommend the Canon T1i to anyone that wants to take great pictures. You can read other reviews for pros and cons on the specs of the camera, but I hope mine relays the message loud and clear. EXCELLENT CAMERA, AND WE ARE BEGINNERS.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Taibah Al-Baker
Reviews.Content: This is my first professional camera. So far so good, reading tutorials and manuals helps you in using it and pushing it to its maximum potential. I love the quality of pictures even with somewhat high ISO. Overall, i couldn't be any happier with my purchase. Perfect pricing and superb quality of build.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: Pros:Good picture quality, fast action, lightweight. Video quality is really stellar.Cons:Feels small in the hands, although this can be a good thing.

Reviews.Title: Why did I wait so long to buy a DSLR?
Reviews.Author: Robert Burmaster
Reviews.Content: I have a decent digital point and shoot camera. But, I became increasingly frustrated with missing shot after shot of my kids and other things because of the slow shutter response time. Plus, I really wanted a camera flexible enough to allow my creativity to grow over time. So, I made the decision to invest in a DSLR. After quite a bit of reading and hemming and hawing, and more reading and more hemming and more hawing, I made the leap and ordered the T1i. It arrived a few days later (thank you, Amazon) and I feel like I've been truly re-awakened to the joys of shooting great photos. This is not THE greatest camera. This is not THE greatest deal. But, it is exceptional and I feel like it is well worth the price. The camera is well set up to help me learn the DSLR ropes and learn how to take better, more creative pictures. The nice thing about a digital camera is you can take lots of practice photos and delete the bad ones. I've been shooting many practice photos whenever I can to try different settings and see how they affect the photos. Then, I just delete them. Eventually, I can upgrade with new lenses and other accessories if I so desire. Net, net, if you are looking to buy a very capable DSLR at a reasonable price, I can positively recommend the T1i. Also, after a few weeks of shooting with the pop-up light, I decided to get myself an extra Christmas present and bought the Canon 270ex Speedlight flash. Been very happy with it as well. Looking forward to lots of great photos yet to come. Merry Christmas to all!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Spencer Dickson "Spud"
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I wanted to upgrade from a film SLR to a digital.  I have been very pleased with all of the features.  I have especially been impressed with the quality of the low light pictures, the continuous shot speed, and the write speed to the memory card (of course that depends on the card you buy but the camera can take pictures very quickly after writing).I am an amateur photographer aspiring to be a professional photographer and I recommend this camera for anybody wanting to learn how to take photographs with a DSLR professionally.  The interface and feature are similar to the professional cameras canon offers. The price is fantastic for what the camera offers.  I have been able to do so much more with this than with my old Rebel GII (which is a great camera, it's just film not digital).

Reviews.Title: Great Beginner SLR Camera
Reviews.Author: RT
Reviews.Content: This is a great digital camera if you're just getting into using SLR cameras. The functions are great and the camera is easy to pick up and get great shots right away. There are a lot of functions that we haven't even gotten into, so I can't wait to discover more!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: zebmobile
Reviews.Content: I just upgraded from a Rebel xt to this one.  The big screen and higher iso are the best part for me.  So many options on this camera.  I love the grip.  I have used the HD video in 780p a couple of times and it's nice.  I won't be using it in place of my camcorder.  It is nice if you need a quick video of something while you are taking some still shots.  Overall a great camera for beginners and vets alike.

Reviews.Title: Great beginner camera for first time SLR user
Reviews.Author: RR
Reviews.Content: Great camera for someone who is new with SLR cameras.  Would recommend purchasing flash for low light or indoor shots. Video is decent.  Overall, pretty good camera.

Reviews.Title: I Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Chapman
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I have nothing negative to say about it.  If I were buying today, I would get T2i for the additional features that were not available when I got my camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, very fast and sharp
Reviews.Author: Pranav Padgoankar "Pranav"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera body only, and got me a 50mm F1.8 lens - my primary objectives being great portraits and good dim light performance. The camera is performing very well. It has great autofocus, even in moonlight. Very fast and almost nil shutter lag. Great quality.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Mrs.Somtiny
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for my birthday and I was extremely pleased with it. The picture quality with the kit lens is outstanding. The only thing I'm not as pleased with is the video auto focus. But instead I just put it onto manual focus and focus myself when taking a video. It still works decent. I finally realized a few days ago how to put the camera on live view while taking a picture and I love it. You have to be on the settings above Creative Auto though but while auto focusing it shows you a green square to let you know it's done. I love this camera. Although, if I did have the choice and money I would have shot for the t2i instead. So if you have the money I would get the t2i. But this is still an amazing camera!*The kit lens shoots outstanding close up shots, it's really good with blurring out the background and focusing on the subject but for landscape type shots it doesn't work as well so I'd like to recommend the EF 50mm f/1.8 prime lens it works extremely well!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: As soon as arrived I tried to use it, opening the box I just got surprised because no SD chip inside (not even a small 512Mb testing one). Since our last Canon camera was a SLR classic (film) we have not much idea about electronics more than small cameras we have. Anyhow,  it worked after learning a little bit using internet about chip class (speed type) and some incompatibilities with some vendors went to a retail and bought 16GB  class 4, and did the job fantastic, it has outstanding performance, very easy to use, handy, good point about 110-220 AC charger, lens anti-vibration system is a big help when you are on a small boat deck, sport mode worked fine for my little princess last basketball match, despite they lost the game I keep some astonishing pictures of her ;-) , it is mac compatible but slow transferring speed  to the computer on USB2 link cable, again this is our first not "entry level" digital camera. ...  and by sure not all the features discovered yet so keep learning more about the product. Please  ponder these comments considering coming from a "photo amateur" family like us

Reviews.Title: A Good Blend of Features
Reviews.Author: Ventura D
Reviews.Content: For its price and size, this camera is an excellent choice. This is not the best Canon camera--it is not a 7D for example. The size of blow-ups and severity of cropping will determine how many MP are needed.  Fifteen megapixels are more than enough for decent sized blow-ups. The T1i is a lot smaller and lighter than the 7D, which was important for me because I planned to take it while backpacking in the Sierra Nevadas. In deciding which camera to buy, I finally realized that now digital DSLRs are really light-capturing computers, and we should purchase the camera with some of the same expectations that we have when buying computers: we don't plan to use them for a decade, but instead expect to upgrade.  So the price (less than half that of a 7D) was a big factor. The money not spent on the body can then go into lenses.I have had no problems with the camera so far (1700 exposures). Folks having experience with Canon DSLRs (I was upgrading from the 300D) will have no trouble navigating the buttons and selections. The large screen and screen resolution are good features.  The smaller physical size is not a problem for folks with large hands (as mine are).This comes with Canon Digital Professional software.  This software allows cropping, rotating, level adjustment, white balance adjustment, etc. of the RAW files. As far as I can see, the software allows application of all of the menu choices that one might make in the camera if one were saving images as JPEG files.  I have found that I don't actually need to go to Photoshop unless I am doing "special effects" as long as I work with RAW files.  Also, I find that printing from the Canon software produces prints on Canon printers that very closely match what I see on my iMac screen.  The RAW format for this camera is CR2, which was not supported by my version of Adobe Photoshop.  I did upgrade my Adobe software (unanticipated additional expense), but it is possible from the Canon software to write a JPEG file ("Convert and Save" from the "File" menu) that can be handled with the older versions of Photoshop.When upgrading the camera, I decided to upgrade my photo habits by recording all photos as RAW (CR2) files.  This of course means upgrading storage capacity--I could only fit 200 images on a DVD-R.  This meant that I had to buy a 650 GB external hard drive.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T1i Review
Reviews.Author: whalegirl "NB"
Reviews.Content: Still getting to know my new camera, but so far I like it a lot.  It is very lightweight, so it is easy to carry around with me.  I used it to shoot a friend's wedding, and they were very pleased with the outcome.  I can't wait to use it out on the water to take shots of the whales!

Reviews.Title: great camera, great deal
Reviews.Author: Denise Rinehart
Reviews.Content: We wanted this camera for our daughter. Shopped around and found the lowest price via Amazon. Saved over $100.00 from nearest competitor. Even Walmart's price was $200.00 more. Daughter LOVES the camera and from the pictures I have seen, it takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Johanna & Todd
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera in order to get better picture quality than our regular point and shoot digital camera and it is amazing.  The camera is very user friendly and so far, we have not had any issues with battery life.  We are not professionals, so this review will not have a bunch of technical lingo in it, but all we can say is that this was a wonderful purchase.  So far, we have not found anything about the camera that we dislike.  We would definitely reccommend this camera to anyone who is looking for beautiful pictures in multiple settings.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the money...
Reviews.Author: V. Florea
Reviews.Content: Very good camera for the money, but not with IS lenses... if you want good picture quality by USM lenses, easy to use, very light camera for DSLR. I have this camera for almost 1 year and the battery life is very good. I would recommend T1i to a friend if you look for camera about 600-800 $...

Reviews.Title: Best price
Reviews.Author: J. Hyde
Reviews.Content: Have been a long-time fan of the value in the Canon Rebel series.  Upgrading to this model, I found that the best price when I was shopping was easily here on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: good quality product
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: Bought it because we will have a baby. It works great, and the quality of the pictures and videos are pretty. For daily use, it is the best one we ever had. Video function is especially useful, and works great in dark light.Like it very much.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: Shaun
Reviews.Content: When i got this camera I started taking oictures right off the bat. I already have a flash for it and it works great. I took it to parties and people keep asking for me to take pictures. I now take pictures of flowers and other things. This is my first camera and it's the best.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel Camera
Reviews.Author: rowgeorge
Reviews.Content: Great camera, pretty easy to get used to, picture quality is excellent, you need to also get a UV and polarized lens for better quality pics

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: hardwater
Reviews.Content: This was my first SLR camera and I think it was a great choice.  I have taken so many pictures that turn out so much better than my other point-n-shoots cameras.  The image quality is awsome and has so many features, still trying to learn them all.  Even tried the video feature over the 4th of July and it works pretty good.  Probably better than my smaller flip flash drive camera.Received the discount for the additional zoom lens making this a great deal.  That was the reason I bought it from Amazon.  I would buy this camera again, and recommend it to people getting into SLR photography.

Reviews.Title: Great.
Reviews.Author: S. Davis
Reviews.Content: I love that I am able to do so much with this camera. Takes great pictures and with a large zoom lense am able to get great close ups.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera the Canon T1i
Reviews.Author: NSB Photographer
Reviews.Content: You will take great pictures with this camera.  You will take pictures that will amaze you.  I have owned and used Canon: Rebel XT, Powershot AS570 IS, EOS Elan 35mm, mechanical FTb 35mm.I have enjoyed using the Canon T1i for almost a year now and have taken some really beautiful photographs with the 15.1 MP APS-C sensor (1.6x compared to 35mm Full Frame Sensor). Good controls when using as a digital camera, you can make it very simple or complex as per your skills.  Lots of helpful features and settings that will make your life easier and your pictures even better.  Multi button pushing for movie/video mode is not so easy, but works ok with some practice. Overall very good camera.  Easy to use and I can say I learned a lot of new things about digital photography by using this camera.  T1i has made me a better photographer because I wanted to learn how to use all of the camera's features and technology to my advantage.I use the camera 95% of the time for digital photography.  So most of my 5 Star review is based on that.  But there is a video mode.  Video good at 720p and 30fps for most subjects.  1080 and 20 fps has nice quality but not good for anything that is in motion as picture skips due to frame rate.  But I must say it is really nice to have the video function on a digital camera, so much nicer to carry one camera instead of two (a video camera and a digital slr).  Digital photo quality is good with kit lens (18-55mm), but much better colors and sharper image with a good lens.  Same with built in flash, it works fine and photos look good, but pictures look so much better with a flash unit attached.  Remember to make good use of 15.1 MP sensor (this is same sensor as in 50D), so use good equipment with this body.  You will be happy with the results.One of the nicest 3 inch LCD screens for live view and photo review.  Body build quality is good, just as long as you aren't too rough on your equipment (marks or scratches show when bumped against other photo equipment).Buy this camera if it is in your budget.  If you can spend more consider T2i with the updates to camera controls and video controls.  Have fun and take a lot of pictures.  You will be very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: I loves my Canon T1i
Reviews.Author: Marlene S. Dishler "Marlene Dishler"
Reviews.Content: The deal I got on this camera is phenominal. The shipping time was excellent and I was able to track it all the way to the nearest drop-off point and I knew exactly when it would get to me. It was packed very well and no problems with anything.  I was able to start taking pictures almost immediately. Since I already own the Canon PowerShot A640, S3is and the S5is, there was little that I had to read to find out where everything I needed was.
